boardgame.name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Scions of the Flame
boardgame.description:
Even amongst the followers of the Ruinous Powers, the Scions of the Flame are zealots. These warriors worship the darkest fires of Aqshy, bringing their blazing wrath to bear on all they deem their enemies.

Sweep all before you with fire and fury – such is the way of the Scions of the Flame! This warband set allows you to field these Aqshian cultists in your battles, containing:


8 multipart plastic Scions of the Flame miniatures – 1 Blazing Lord, 1 Brazen Champion, 1 Inferno Priest, 1 Immolator, 2 Fireborn, and 2 Initiates, with a variety of weapons options
A Scions of the Flame abilities card, allowing you to unleash the distinctive and deadly battle tactics of this warband in your games
11 fighter cards for seeing your rules at a glance, plus divider cards for tracking your tokens


—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry Starter Set
Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Catacombs
Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Core Book

boardgame.name: Gormley-Watt Velosteamer's Touring Guide
boardgame.description:
Looking for larger, more detailed maps to help you navigate through the world of Steam Highwayman? Keen to have a definitive list of all the pubs, inns, taverns and hostelries in the first three volumes, helping you reach that lofty goal of drinking every beer in the three books? Well, it sounds like you need The Gormley-Watt Velosteamer’s Touring Guide (Number 1) for Marlow, High Wycombe, Henley, Wallingford and London.

The guide contains three A2 colour-printed maps, clearly indicating the explorable routes in each volume, key locations, sites of particular interest and, crucially, the whereabouts of the many pubs. A guide booklet lists those pubs, together with other shops and places to purchase equipment or find repairs, and offers the touring velosteamer several scenic routes through Smog & Ambuscade and Highways and Holloways. The scenic routes are well worth the experience both within the books and in our own time and sphere of existence.

boardgame.name: Nachod and Skalitz 1866
boardgame.description:
End of June 1866. After several months of mounting tensions, war has broken out between Austria and Prussia for preeminent control in Germany. Prussia plans for its troops to cross the Sudetes and penetrate Bohemia by 4 different passages with the objective of confronting the principal Austrian Army in a decisive Napoleonic battle. The outlet of one of these passages was here, near the towns of Nachod and Skalitz. The Prussian V Corps was in position to take control of it and allow the VI Corps to follow it before converging with the other Prussian corps on the centre of the Austrian presence. General Steinmetz is appointed commander of the Prussian 1st Army in 1870 and will have to confront the Austrian troops sent by General Benedek.

As a new unit of the series “Battles in the era of Napoleon III”, Nachod-Skalitz is the first game of a series that will cover the principal clashes of the campaign in Bohemia of 1866, concluding with the battle of Sadowa. Players will have the option of playing the battles one after another in a campaign mode, resulting perhaps in a very different situation by the time they arrive at the decisive battle of 3 July 1866.

Using the series “The Great Battles of Napoleon III” (VaeVictis # 55, # 73 and 138), the system is simple and dynamic with an accent on the engagement of the troops against deadly defensive fire.

—user summary

Scale :

Game turn : one hour
Counters : regiments and battalions
Map : one hex. = 750 m
Complexity : 5/10
Solo playability : 7/10
Duration : 2 to 4 hours depending on the scenario

(sources : rulebook and description from the Publisher)
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Les Grandes Batailles de Napoleon III (Vae Victis)

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: FRENCH VERSION, English rules available for download via: https://www.vaevictismag.fr/en/content/9-english-rules

boardgame.name: Railroad Ink: Giant Box
boardgame.description: Store your whole Railroad ink collection in one single, neat package! This magnetically-sealed box can hold all of the content.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Railroad Ink Challenge: Lush Green Edition
Railroad Ink Challenge: Shining Yellow Edition

boardgame.name: Aufgepasst!: Ein Verkehrsspiel
boardgame.description:
The players start at space 1. The first to reach space 80 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events or traffic rules hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Kugelblitz
boardgame.description:
65 balls are filled into the funnel-shaped top part of the ball tower and randomly distributed on the five vertical lanes, where they remain stacked.

In the base plate, below these stacks of balls, there are sliders with troughs in which the lowest ball in each case can be pulled out to one or the other player. The aim is to get as many balls of the same color as possible on one's own side in each turn. The winner is the player who has the most balls at the end - regardless of color.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Meister Lampe und seine Familie
boardgame.description:
In the game, 32 bunny cards, each with 8 bunnies of one player color, are face down. The player whose turn it is rolls the die once and may reveal a card on a 5 or 6. If it is a card of your own color, you may keep it, otherwise you put it back face down. You may then continue to reveal cards until another player rolls a 5 or 6. If you roll a 1, you lose a bunny if you have collected an odd number of cards. The first player to collect 8 bunnies wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Planevo
boardgame.description:
The game deals with personality development and the experience of happiness. Players move along a life path, starting at birth, through childhood, adolescence, adulthood, always on the way to happiness. The movement of the game pieces is controlled first by a dice and later by cards. The cards also contain texts with positive and negative experiences, which materialize green happiness stones and / or black ballast stones that you carry in a backpack. At some points in the game, only a certain amount of ballast may be carried. If you have too much, you have to go back and try to get rid of the ballast. In addition, you collect suns and stars on a characteristic board, which in turn must be filled to a certain degree to be allowed to enter the target field. The winner is the one who could collect the most stars.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Wortklaubereien
boardgame.description:
The players have a bag with tactile plastic letters. A term with words of 3, 4 or 5 letters is revealed. Everyone now searches in their bag - without looking inside - for the matching letters and lays them out. The first player to do so receives the term card. The player who has collected the most cards wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Dunlop Tennis-Cup
boardgame.description:
A tennis game in 3 difficulty levels for beginners, advanced and professionals. Played with a plastic chip that is flicked over the net with a "racket". The difficulty levels are:
Beginner: The chip must be flicked into the opponent's court. For a mistake the opponent gets a point. With 10 points you win a game, with 2 games you win a match.
Advanced: The game is played according to table tennis rules. In addition, there are fields in the opponent's area on which you can make direct points.
Professionals: It is played according to tennis rules. In addition, there are fields in the opponent's area on which you can make direct points.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Lock and Key (SW)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Since the dawn of fantasy roleplaying games, opening locks has been a staple of fantasy adventures. This mini-supplement for the worlds most popular roleplaying game is filled with information about locks and how to open them.

Lock and Key includes:

A real-world history of locks and keys
Ideas for a fantasy history
Variant Locks – Including real world items like false keyholes, and fantasy items like talking locks
A random key generator
2 new traps
4 new magic items
1 new spell
3 new monsters

boardgame.name: Darkness Moves
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Violet Valley has a conflicted past of heroic deeds and nasty persecution. Now afflicted with a blight of dark continuous rain, the valley is slowly turning into a boggy mire. The small village of Argol is at risk of losing its major crop of blackberries to the encroaching swamp. Additionally, villagers have begun to disappear in mysterious and grisly fashion to a supposed pack of rabid wolves. Superstition, paranoia, guilt, shame all weigh heavy on the Valley.

Darkness Moves is a short adventure for use with the game Cairn. Though with some stat changes, can be used with many old-school, rules lite games.

Two small one page dungeons are available for exploration. A small hex map with several detailed locations. A bestiary of six creatures.

Darkness Moves can be a simple side quest to drop into an overall campaign or be a fairly easy first adventure for a new Cairn party.

boardgame.name: Ghost Ship
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

HOSTILE Situation Reports - Free one-page NPCs or adventure situations for the gritty HOSTILE setting.

A mayday signal draws the PCs to a lonely gas giant, and a starship in an extremely low, atmosphere-grazing orbit. There's no response ... can the crew be saved? Are they even still alive?

boardgame.name: Snakehead
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

HOSTILE Situation Reports - Free one-page NPCs or adventure situations for the gritty HOSTILE setting.

Meet Baosheng, a veteran Snakehead operating in the Off-World colonies. His syndicate specialises in techno-crime and the theft of shuttle craft. He has a job you might like ... it's just a pity you're a deniable asset and he is posing as a legit businessman. What could go wrong?

boardgame.name: Class Toolkit Compendium
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the Class Toolkit Compendium for Low Fantasy Gaming!! In this tome you will find a humongous amount new class abilities and content to personalize your character!

Within includes the ravings of a goblin scrivener:

190+ New class abilities to customize your favorites! (Including the Psion & Druid)
The Druid Class: A wild shaping druid, inspired by classic fantasy themes
The Folio of Classic Races: A quick guide for using new races in Low Fantasy Gaming, emulating old school feels of the game that started it all! (14 in total)
A few new weapons scattered about!
2 New Unique Features, Druidic Gifts (Cross Class) & Find Familiar!

boardgame.name: Fate of the Arkadia
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“You will never find a more wretched hive of scum and villainy.” Obi-Wan Kenobi

When a colony ship is found ten years after it disappeared, a ragtag team of mercenaries is sent to investigate the derelict. Thus begins a mystery and action-packed adventure in the outer reaches of the galaxy, where smugglers and pirates rule over strange, alien worlds.

Fate of the Arkadia is a classic space western adventure inspired by the rollicking space opera stories we all know and love. It is designed to be played in two or three sessions and requires the ELEMENTAL Complete Guide. Drop it into your campaign or play it as an unforgettable one-shot using the seven pre-generated characters provided.

boardgame.name: Fools Haven Adventures Volume 1
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Fools Haven, City of Adventure, the Jewel of the Middenbight, and your new home. Adventurers from throughout the Vague World have braved the many dangers of the borderlands to seek their destiny as Free Traders within its mighty walls and some have even succeeded in making a little coin in the process.

But the life of a Free Trader is a difficult one and many have abandoned the call to adventure or have given their lives following its siren song. But never fear, for where others have failed you shall surely succeed with the aid of these useful handbooks published by the Middenbight Midnight Mail!

In Fools Haven, players take on the roles of Free Traders: adventurers, mercenaries, and entrepreneurs who have abandoned the simple life in favour of one of glory and great reward. But a Free Trader's life is a risky one filled with peril and misfortune, and not every employer cares about the well-being of their Free Trader freelancers.

Fools Haven Adventures Vol 1 outlines a set of adventures to entice and excite even the most jaded of Free Traders, mostly taken from articles found in the Middenbight Midnight Mail. All adventures are system and edition neutral and can be scaled to suit both the newest and most seasoned of Free Traders.

Adventures include:

The Gate Job: In order to get a job, you'll need a Free Traders License. In order to get a License, you'll need money. But in order to get money, you'll need a job. It's a vicious cycle for a newcomer to town, but a local city watchman is willing to help you out...
Hunt For A Hero: Captain Kinnen is the noblest, kindest, and most respected of all the halfling heroes in Fools Haven. And you've been offered your weight in silver to kill him before dawn.
The Unicorn Dilemma: A group of Free Traders must act as brokers for a dragon who wishes to sell a baby unicorn. The rewards are exemplary, but can you wash the bad taste out of your mouth?
O Elusive Muse!: The operetta Glimmerwind promises to be the most exciting stage-show to grace the Garden District this season, but a series of troubles have plagued the production and with only two weeks until opening night the show is looking to become a disaster! Can a small group of talented Free Traders save Glimmerwind?
Gash's Gauntlet: Gash Throatripper is the star forward rover for the Freiberg Bruisers and the greatest orc player ever to take to playing Bawll. But a lot of people want rival team the Freiberg Bloods to win and the likelihood of Gash making it to the game tomorrow are one in a hundred. You've taken those odds.
A Pyramid Scheme: Dark magician Amet Hatehopeth has just started down the path of necromancy and hopes to become a mummy someday. He requires Free Traders to arrange for investors to help him build a mighty pyramid in his honour. Can you convince some of the most dangerous citizens of Fools Haven to become shareholders in his nefarious venture?

boardgame.name: Favored of the Gods (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

'Ssavara caught her friend’s scent just before Wakuru’s form reappeared beside her. “You were right,” Wakuru told Ssavara. “We can always count on your keen sense of smell to track down anything. There are six well-armed fighters guarding the chalice and I overheard them saying the highest bid so far is 2,000 gold. They’re not letting anyone in armed, so it’s a good thing we’ve got other options.”

“When I give the signal, you hit them with your mind blast, “ Ssavara told Wakuru as she allowed her venomous saliva to drip onto a wicked-looking dagger. Seconds later her appearance changed from an anthropomorphic red-scaled ophidian to a red-haired human beauty in seconds. Ssavara tucked the envenomed dagger into her bodice, gave Wakuru a wink, and said, “Let’s get this chalice back to the monastery where it belongs!”

Ancestral Anthologies Vol. 3: Favored of the Gods provides you with the rules for the following:

Rules for 7 new ancestries, each with its own unique heritages and ancestry feats. In total, you’ll find 19 new heritages among the ancestries and 139 new ancestral feats!

Duskari - Duskari hail from a gigantic underground cavern, and stand 7 feet tall, as strong as the stones that surround their homes. The gentle giants are capable of bringing the heat in combat, though most prefer a calmer approach.

Ekko - The blue-skinned Ekkos were once creatures without a physical form, but now they delight in the sensations available to them through their bodies. Able to tap into incredible mind-powers, they set out to experience everything that the world has to offer.

Runiqs - Infused with the magic of the gods, and marked upon their skin with strange runes, these powerful elemental-like do not set out to change the world. Instead they become on with nature and work to protect it as best as they can.

Sedevas - The angelic Sedevas were once part of the celestial host, but fell in love with a mortal charge, and requested a boon from their gods: To live among the mortals and be one with them, to be with the person they loved. Their boon was granted, but they lost their ability to fly, and they cannot leave behind their true nature and set out to help those around them.

Ssindar - The ophidian shapeshifters of the Ssindar live in places that are inhospitable to most. The deepest of deserts and beneath volcanic mountains. Here the humanoids can be their true forms, a serpentine natural anthropomorphic form while being able to use their human form for when they have to go elsewhere. Their powers vary greatly by the individual - some have burning breath, while others spit acid, but common to them all is the love of their tribe.

Tarri - Tarri are bipedal humanoids with the upper body of an elf with an antlered head and the legs of a reindeer. So rare that most think they’re satyrs, few have ever seen them. Tarri live both among elves and centaurs, and quickly learn to use their agility and speed to the fullest. They’re headstrong, but love their home and friends, and would do anything for them.

T’Veelu - The T’veelu are scorpion people, humanoids with stingers or multi-jointed legs. The T’veelu are hardy, preferring a nomadic lifestyle in the deserts where they make their homes, working together to bring down prey bigger than an individual could. Because of their grey or blue skin, they’re often mistaken for drow. A nasty surprise awaits those that irritate or threaten a T’veelu when making such a mistake.

boardgame.name: Favored of the Gods (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

'Ssavara caught her friend’s scent just before Wakuru’s form reappeared beside her. “You were right,” Wakuru told Ssavara. “We can always count on your keen sense of smell to track down anything. boardgame.description:

Ancestral Anthologies Vol. 3: Favored of the Gods provides you with the rules for the following:

Rules for 6 new races, each with its own unique racial traits. On top of that, you’ll find another 25 alternate racial traits, 3 new Cleric Subdomains, 3 new Oracle mysteries, and 1 new Ranger archetype.

boardgame.name: Weißt du noch...?: Die 50er
boardgame.description:
The theme of the game is to put events from the 1950s in the correct chronological order and bring memories to life with narration.

Text and picture cards (movie posters) are shuffled separately and stacked. Each player gets one movie poster card and three text cards and places them in front of them. The cards must now be put in the correct order, for this you may look at the date on the back of the movie poster. Once everyone has laid out an order, the players take turns presenting the events; memories and stories come into play. You get one point for each correct card, in case of doubt the year counts. Whoever has the most points after an agreed number of rounds wins.

—user summary

listing.notes: Unopened, in perfect condition, brand new. Nonsmoker household without animals. Payment via PayPal or wire transfer. (The buyer bears any costs that may arise upon payment and shipping.)

boardgame.name: Letter Drop
boardgame.description:
Drop Letters. Make Words. Score Points

Letter Drop is where you'd expect the exact centre of the Venn diagram between Scrabble and Connect Four would be. A fresh fusion of two old games, Letter Drop gives players the vocabulary and resource management of Scrabble, and the visual area control of Connect Four!

Players choose a tile from a small "hand" of tiles of their colour, and place it into the grid to form a high scoring word, or potentially block an opponent. The game ends when the entire grid is full, and all 42 letters have been placed.

The player with the most points wins the round, and the first player to two rounds won, wins. Alternate colours each round, as each colour has a different combination of letters.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Iron Horse
boardgame.description:
A diverse team of outlaws have assembled for the gold heist of the century. Leveraging your unique skills and abilities, send your gang out into the territories to complete side objectives to help your efforts and fight off the Sheriff and Deputy as you try to steal gold from the train. You must act fast though! When the train reaches its final destination, your time to steal the gold is over and you'll fail your mission.

Iron Horse is a fully co-operative, push your luck, dice roller featuring six unique characters. These characters all come with their own special abilities and unlockable upgrades.

Components:
1 Central Board with Map and Train
6 Character Mats each with 8 unique upgrade cards and special ability tokens
12 Resource tokens
1 Wanted Poster token
6 Custom Dice
Law Card Deck
Quick Draw Card Deck
25 Map Points of Interest Tokens
1 Train Piece
1 Gang of Horses Piece

boardgame.name: Atlanta Class Carrier
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Prepare to launch fighters!

One of the largest ships in Earth Sector, the Atlanta-class carrier is the main capital ship of the Southern Alliance Navy. The Atlanta-class carriers are often the centerpiece of a strike group and stand ready to launch their fighters.

The Atlanta-class carrier is a 3800 tonne vessel which is heavily armed and armored. The Atlanta also carries 50 F-40B Tomcat fighters and 15 B-44A Archangel strike craft. In short, the Atlanta is prepared for action.

This book contains full deckplans for the Atlanta prepared by our starship guru, Michael Johnson. This is accompanied by beautiful art by fan favorite Ian Stead. Inside this book, you will learn about the Atlanta, its history, and its future.

Also included is full information concerning the F-40B Tomcat and the B-44A Archangel.

In addition, new rules are included concerning small craft weapons such as missiles, rapid fire railguns, lasers, and particle beams.

boardgame.name: Berge
boardgame.description:
Players are given mountain cards in 3 categories (difficulty of climbing the mountains), which they must work through to the end of the game. You move your figure through Switzerland by rolling the dice and can climb your mountains (dice test). If this succeeds no later than the 3rd time, you get paid a bonus. In addition, a question is asked, the correct answer also earns a bonus. If other players come to your mountain, they have to pay a fee. Further fields trigger events that cost or bring in money. The player who has completed all the mountain cards may run back to the combined start/finish field. Here there are again bonuses for the first, second and third player. The player who has collected the most money wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Dael Segrach - The Elves
boardgame.description:
When the Elves fled, they left behind destruction and death. The world became a frozen wasteland home to corrupted horrors and the dreaded Blood Lords. But unbeknown to the people of the Last City, the elves have been sending their Rangers, a highly trained specialist team of spell wielding warriors, to seek out the knowledge and artefacts the elves left behind.

This new source material for the Black Iron 5th edition setting lets you play as one of these Rangers, returning to the hell you created and a land where you are hated and hunted by those you doomed to suffer. You will need to avoid not only the adventures and mercenaries sent by the guilds and the Remnant to find the very same items you seek but also the corrupted monsters, cultists and fanatics that now inhabit the land beyond the sun spires.

This PDF contains everything you need to create Dael (elven) characters and become the Dael Segrach (elven rangers) or have them as NPCs to face off against your band of mercenaries already travelling the Pale.

boardgame.name: Icosium
boardgame.description:
Test your knowledge of Algeria while having fun. 2,000 questions including 70% related to Algeria. 5 categories of questions: history, geography, culture & traditions, sport, gastronomy

Each player places his pawn at the door to Algeria matching his color. Movement around the board is determined by whether a player can answer the question alone, with help, or not at all. The first player to make it round the board back to his starting point wins the game.

Alone or in a team, the goal of Icosium is to be the first to tour the 48 Wilayas by correctly answering the five categories of questions.

–Description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dreamember
boardgame.description:
The dream fades and only a trace remains... Now you have to try to remember the word and the image of the dream.

Dreamember is a bluffing word game in which players try to get rid of the cards in their hands by making words out of the letters in play. The player who first empties their hand discovers the word of the dream and wins.

All the cards show a piece of the dream image and can be placed together to recompose it as a solo activity.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Les Apaches de Paris
boardgame.description:
At the beginning of the 20th century, in the suburbs of Paris during a time of catastrophic economic and social upheaval, young people get together to form the gangs of Ménilmontant, Montmartre and elsewhere. They are Les Apaches de Paris.

You lead a gang of "Apaches" and have to become master of the place to get rich. Place or move your Apaches and, in spite of your uncertainties, impose your strategy thanks to the information progressively revealed by each player. Find and control the most lucrative "hideouts" but beware of traps, rival gangs and city sergeants.

Control the best spots, get the most money and become the best of Les Apaches de Paris.


A la tête de votre bande d’Apaches, soyez majoritaire uniquement dans les quartiers lucratifs. Ainsi vous éviterez le pire et connaitrez notoriété et richesse.

Serez-vous tacticien, bluffeur, intuitif, prudent, courageux ou tout cela en même temps ?
Début du 20ème siècle… Issus des faubourgs de Paris, dans un contexte économique et social catastrophique, sans éducation et livrés à eux-mêmes, des jeunes liés par leur quartier d’origine se regroupent pour créer les gangs de Ménilmontant, de Montmartre ou d’ailleurs... Ils sont appelés « Les Apaches de Paris » en référence aux Apaches de Geronimo.

Vous dirigez un gang « d’Apaches » et devez devenir maître de lieux pour vous enrichir. Placez ou déplacez vos Apaches et malgré vos incertitudes, imposez votre stratégie grâce aux informations dévoilées progressivement par chaque joueur. Trouvez les « planques » les plus lucratives mais attention aux pièges, aux bandes rivales et aux sergents de ville.

Les points forts du jeu sont :

Accessible et très stratégique
Grande profondeur de jeu et rejouabilité
Tension et prise de risque à chaque coup joué

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Reign of Iron
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Monster hunt oneshot for levels 3, 9, and 16
...
Years ago, Haemspire Peak was home to the Order of Haem, a hermitage for holy monks led by the magnetite dragon Lorhaem the Even and her offspring. This monastic order kept to themselves, unconcerned with the world and its wars, land grabs, and greed. Their tenet was a simple one, to maintain the Material Plane’s neutrality in the eternal fight between heavens and the hells.

boardgame.name: Anime 5E
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Watching anime movies or reading a manga series doesn’t quite provide the immersive experience that some people crave. These inspired individuals don’t just want to passively watch fantasy anime – they want to live it and experience it and be consumed by it. Even playing anime-themed video games doesn’t provide the creative outlet whereby players can live the adventures of their favourite anime characters. An anime and manga role-playing game – just like the one you’re reading – fills this dramatic need perfectly.
boardgame.rpgseries: Anime 5E: Fifth Edition Fantasy Role-Playing Adventures

boardgame.name: The game is drawn: strategy
boardgame.description:
The game is drawn is a collection of pen&paper games, playable on a small erasable board and pencil format. Each product in the line has a different theme, and includes 10 games.

The game is drawn - strategy - is the first in the collection and includes 10 strategy games:

SQU, by Nestor Romeral Andres
Do and Undo, by Marcello Bertocchi
Tumbleweed, by Mike Zapawa
Spiderlings, by 4brains4games
Password, by Hjalmar Hach
Stampede, by Walter Joris
Yavalath, by LUDI and Cameron Browne
Cartesio, by Silvano Sorrentino
Quartieri, by Dieter Stein
9tka, by Adam Kaluza

boardgame.name: Overboard!
boardgame.description:
Overboard! is a whodunnit where you’re the one whodunnit. You have just eight hours to cover the evidence, mislead the witnesses, frame another suspect and escape ... if you can!

A next-gen visual novel. Choose every line and every action. Go where you want, when you want. But the other characters are watching and won’t forget what they see!
Choices that really matter. Build and execute your strategy, but watch out: every step you take will have consequences.
NPCs with their own agendas. Other characters move around the ship in real time. Will you mislead them? Avoid them? Blackmail them? Silence them? It’s up to you.
Massively replayable. Each time through can be wildly different. What you learn in one run will give you new things to try on the next.
The Story
July, 1935. Wealthy Malcolm Villensey’s fortune has been wiped out overnight. He and his starlet wife, Veronica, have escaped aboard the SS Hook for a new life in America—but Mrs. Villensey has other plans. And one little push is all it takes.

The clock is ticking. In eight hours the boat will dock and you’ll need to answer for Malcolm’s whereabouts.
No crime is perfect. There are always witnesses. But how will you find out who saw what, without giving the game away?
No one is innocent. Every passenger has something to hide. Can you turn their secrets to your advantage?
Suicide isn’t enough. Malcolm had a generous life insurance policy, but you can only claim the cash by framing someone else for murder.

Source: The Developer Website.

Horror w Arkham: Gra Karciana – Na krawędzi Ziemi: Rozszerzenie kampanijne
boardgame.description:
In the far, uncharted reaches of Antarctica, unspeakable horrors dwell on the edge of shadows.

The Edge of the Earth Campaign Expansion has no player cards in sight. Instead, this expansion contains over 300 scenario cards to support the entirety of the Edge of the Earth campaign, including the materials for a breathtaking new story, branching paths, and more. The best part? All you need is a core set and a copy of this expansion to jump right into this chilling tale—no other materials required!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Wandering Stars
boardgame.description:
A rules light rpg of wandering space, encountering odd adventures and horrifying events.

Taking huge inspiration, and many times directly ripping, from In the Light of a Ghost Star and Tunnel Goons from Nate Treme along with sprinkling of Maze Rats by Ben Milton, Wandering Stars started as a way to play all the weird, quirky or terrifying one-shot adventures I’ve collected over the years in a framework of a typical science fiction “away party”.

The game includes the core rules, 3 hex maps full of weird places to visit, one underground dungeon and a horror adventure set on a space station, along with plenty of tables to roll on.

boardgame.name: Sarge [1985]
boardgame.description:
Back of box

Well, Private, are you ready to work your way up through the ranks? These are the toughest maneuvres you're even likely to see, but the stakes are high - show a little brains and a lot of guts and they'll be calling you Sarge in no time! And if you've really got the right stuff, you might even make General before the game is up!

You're in charge of the toughest bunch of yahoos ever to graduate boot camp. You've got a tank, a chopper and plenty of ammo. But so does the enemy! You've got to out-gun, out-fly and out-maneuver them at every turn, or you'll be scrubbing latrines for the rest of the war!

Play against the computer's amy or a friend's army; or join forces with your friend's army against the computer. But any way you play it, you're in for a battle that would have made Patton shake in his boots. Now, get out there and own those stripes - Sarge!

boardgame.name: Sword & Sorcery: Ancient Chronicles – Treasure Chest
boardgame.description:
This is a big box, with the outward appearance of a treasure chest, which was the last stretch goal of the Ancient Chronicles Kickstarter campaign. It houses the Wave 1 components, mostly as retail boxes.

The Kickstarter campaign had just one pledge level, Legendary Hero, which was broken down into three parts:

Ancient Chronicles Core Set and Campaign
Kickstarter Bonus Set
Challenge Set


Two bundles of add-ons were offered. The Bronze Bundle consisted of:

Tristan Hero & Ally
Metal Crowns
Doors & Chests miniatures
Extra Dice set
Critical Hit bag


Tristan, the Metal Crowns, and the Doors & Chests were not included in any other combo, while a dice set and a critical bag were already part of the rewards.

The Gold Bundle grouped the remaining add-ons:

Myths of the Arena (Wave 2)
Chaotic Familiars (5 miniatures, cards, reference sheet)
Lawful Familiars (5 miniatures, cards, reference sheet)
Genryu/Shakiko Hero Pack (6 miniatures, hero sheets, enemy sheets, cards, tokens, reference sheet)
Sigrid/Sigurd Hero Pack (6 miniatures, hero sheets, enemy sheets, cards, tokens, reference sheet)
Alternate Hero Set (5 miniatures, cards, tokens, reference sheet)
Ghost Soul Forms (5 miniatures)
Alternate Ghost Soul Forms (5 miniatures)


All of these, except the Myths of the Arena, are in the Treasure Chest.

The Treasure Chest also includes five more boxes that accommodate most of the remaining Kickstarter rewards:

Spawn Gates and Gods' Altars (7 miniatures)
Minions (20 miniatures)
Nemeses (6 miniatures, venture card, enemy power card, enemy cards, enemy scrolls, tokens, 2 reference sheets)
Act I Challenge Set (16 miniatures, cards, enemy scrolls, reference sheet)

boardgame.name: Neopolis
Neoville
boardgame.description:
Neoville is looking for architects to build a city that is a combination of human habitation and the natural world. Are you up to the challenge? Position tiles strategically to build skyscrapers and utilities in your 4×4 city. Skyscrapers will be worth harmony points at the end of the game based on their value and district size. Utilities will be worth harmony points when their position in the city fits their own requirements. However, skyscrapers or utilities that do not meet their requirements will count as negative points! Who will design the most harmonious city with nature?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Kingdomino Origins
Kingdomino: Kezdetek
Лоскутное королевство. Истоки
boardgame.description:
Go back in time to the prehistoric era of Kingdomino!

Kingdomino Origins plays similarly to the original game, but introduces new components for additional actions and new ways to score points. Regions in your territory will earn you points if they contain fire. Fire is either part of your terrains or earned by adding dominoes with volcanoes. There are three game modes to play:


The first one introduces fire and volcanoes;
The second mode uses wooden resources;
And the third one features cavemen tokens.


You earn points by collecting resources, with additional points when you have the majority of a type of resources. These resources allow you to bring cavemen to your territory, and each type of caveman has its own way to give you points based on their position.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Munchkin: SpongeBob SquarePants
boardgame.description:
Immerse yourself in the whimsical worlds of Bikini Bottom mixed with Steve Jackson Games' classic role-playing card game Munchkin!

In Munchkin: SpongeBob SquarePants, you can play as your favorite SpongeBob SquarePants character and equip yourself with items such as Krusty Krab Hat and Allies like Gary the Snail to defeat monsters and win an underwater race to Level 10!

—description from the publisher

listing.notes: Title: Munchkin: SpongeBob SquarePants Publisher: Steve Jackson Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Election Night in America
boardgame.description:
Election Night in America is a 2 to 4 player game where you are a candidate running for the Presidency.

Each player chooses a party and a candidate to run for office. It is up to you to strategize and balance four types of influence, represented by cards: finance, social media, religion, and politics. You will need to navigate the political landscape by rolling dice to avoid scandals and your opponent's schemes. Using influence, you will attempt to win electoral votes for each state.

Will you have the political clout to win the 270 electoral votes to become president?

You will be able to find this game available on KICKSTARTER this fall.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: The Chaco War, 1932-1935
boardgame.description:
The Chaco War was fought out by two landlocked countries, Bolivia and Paraguay in South America. On paper, the Bolivians should win handily: they enjoyed a three to one superiority in manpower against the Paraguayans. However, to reach the front the Bolivians had to overcome long lines of communication, impossible terrain and low morale. The Paraguayans, on the other hand, saw the war as a life-or-death struggle. Thanks to their superior morale and leadership, the Paraguayans inflicted a series of defeats to the Bolivians and won most of the Chaco in the post-war peace settlement.

Components: 22x34 inch map, 176 die-cut counters.

World at War #86, OCT-NOV 2022.

boardgame.name: Temple Challenge
boardgame.description:
Inspired by the lost pyramid temple cities found deep in the Rain Forest, this game takes on a character of it's own. If you have ever played the game Aggravation, then think how much more fun it would be playing it in 3D!

The Temple Challenge game is approximately 12 inches square by 2 & 1/4 inches tall. Comes with 4 sets of 4 matching marbles, instructions, and a set of dice.

Up to 4 players at a time can play Temple Challenge, each player gets 4 marbles to try and win by making it to the top and out of the Temple.

The end of the game comes when a player gets all of their marbles to their home row.

"—description from the publisher"

boardgame.name: You've Lost Your Marbles!
boardgame.description:
50 marbles of each color are provided but the game may be played with less marbles as long as both sides start out with an equal amount.

To play this game you start by rolling a dice to see who will go first. Each player will then roll the dice twice for each move to be made, but only moves marbles after the second roll.

The first roll is the determining number.

In the second roll there are three possibilities. If the second number is less than the first roll, you have to give your opponent the amount of your colored marbles you rolled the first time.

If the second roll is higher, then you subtract your first role from the second and take that many of your opponents marbles or take your own colored marbles back along with any of your opponents to complete the number amount.

If you roll the same number both times (same dice combination), you get to take the total of both roles of your opponents colored marbles or a combination of yours and your opponents to match the total number.

If you roll the same total numbers again, then you pass the turn on to your opponent without moving any marbles at all.

The game ends when one side has lost all of their own colored marbles.

"—description from the publisher"

boardgame.name: Corona Downs
boardgame.description:
First, all the marbles are placed on the board behind the start line. Marbles will be moving to the right or counter clockwise during play. Two dice are rolled to determine the odds for each marble racer from the inside track to the outside track. For instance, if on the roll for marble racer number one a 5 and a 2 are rolled then the odds for that racer is 7 to 1.

The house starts with $1,000,000 (Million Dollars) and each player starts with $100,000 each to place bets on the racers. (This starting amount can be changed).

Each racer is worth $1,000 a race (again this amount can be changed or even randomly set by the roll of the dice) Example, if a player loses on a racer, they lose a thousand bucks! But if they win on a racer they get paid whatever the odds are on that racer: Example, if the racer has odds of 5 to 1 then they win $5,000. A player can place bets on more than one racer at a time.

The dice are rolled for each racer until one racer crosses the finish line. One designated player can roll all the dice for the game or each player can take turns.

The end of the game comes when someone loses all their cash or when a set number of races are run as determined by the players before the start of the game.

With this game you have the option to even make up your own rules, maybe you have some good ideas for how to set up betting for this game.

"—description from the publisher"

boardgame.name: Fractured Minds
boardgame.description:
Inspired by Emily’s personal journey through severe anxiety Fractured Minds seeks to create greater understanding and stand in solidarity with mental health sufferers around the world. Players will embark on a deeply personal and emotional journey through the human psyche. Exploring atmospheric and thought-provoking chapters, each symbolizing a different aspect or challenge associated with mental health — from isolation to anxiety, with everyday situations becoming distorted beyond recognition.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Ushuaïa
boardgame.description:
Ushuaïa is a family game inviting you to explore the world and its riches and protect the environment, while having fun.

Each explorer moves around the photos on the board and takes on different challenges to earn exploration tokens and complete their mission sheet.
There are 4 types of challenges: our world, exploration, surprising planet and preserving the earth.

The explorer who fills his/her mission card first (6 tokens) is the winner.

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Cepheus Journal (Issue 006)
boardgame.description:
From the website description

Welcome to issue #006 of the Cepheus Journal. This is a fantasy only issue and we have saved other submitted content for later issues, a big thank you to the authors who have submitted.

This issue we have more great articles. This fantasy special issue kicks off with a review of Barbaric! by our own Brett Kruger, followed by more articles on the fantasy theme. There’s the Swashbuckler advanced combat rules from Peter Kreft, some expositions on dragons (Jo Jaquinta), kobolds (our own Paul Drye), and Quantum sorcery (Steve Attwood).

The ever proficient Timothy Collinson gives a Barbaric! NPC to use in games, while our own P-O Bergstedt gives us the Octorus to use in his Störtebeker, or any, fantasy setting. And finally, something we’ve not had before, some fiction from Robert L S Weaver, The Dead Forest.

boardgame.name: Space Empires: 4X – 3" Box
boardgame.description: 3" Box for 1st–3rd printings of Space Empires 4X. The Fourth Printing already comes in 3-inch box.

boardgame.name: Watch on the Oder: January 1945
boardgame.description:
Watch on the Oder: January 1945 is a hypothetical two-player game allowing the players to examine the strategic possibilities inherent in the campaign that may have taken place had Hitler decided to send the forces he used historically in the Ardennes to the eastern front. Both sides’ orders of battle are entirely historic within that context. Each of the eight game turns represents four days, and each large hex on the map equals 20 miles. The map runs from the Oder River on the west to the Riga-Pinsk line on the east. Units are German corps and Soviet armies. The turn sequence is I-Go-U-Go, but both players decide if their force will move and fight or fight and move. Playing time is about three hours, and is easily adapted for solitaire play. Complexity is low-medium. The German has to strike hard and fast at the beginning in order to weaken the inevitable Soviet counteroffensive.

Components: 22x34 inch map, 128 die-cut counters.

World at War #82 February-March 2022

boardgame.name: Shin Megami Tensei Nocturne 真・女神転生
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the “World” of SMT 3: Nocturne. The world as you would know it has ended, and a new world is going to be born. All of existence is gone except for Tokyo, which has been warped into a spherical world where the sky is another part of the city, known as the Vortex World. In the center of it all lies Kagutsuchi, a sphere of light that whose brightness waxes and wanes as time goes on. At the end of times, it will be the one to determine the new world, based on the Reason it is given.

boardgame.name: Operation Causeway: Formosa 1944
boardgame.description:
Operation Causeway: Formosa 1944 is an operational-level two player wargame covering the planned but never executed Allied invasion of the Allied island of Formosa in World War II. Had the operation been executed, it would have been the largest amphibious invasion of the Pacific Theater of Operations. The Allied objective is to gain control of Formosa with a minimal number of losses. The Japanese objective is to inflict sufficient cost in terms of manpower and delay to make the invasion counterproductive for the Allies.

Components: 22x34 inch map, 176 die-cut counters.

World at War #83, April-May 2022

boardgame.name: CyberJudas

Back of box

"Hello. I'm one of your advisors. I'm going to destroy the United States and the world will think you did it. Why am I doing this? We all have our reasons. I'm just ready to act to mine. See you at the fire..."

CyberJudas is the ultimate game of power, global leadership and world influence. Become the most powerful person on earth supported by a close and trusted panel of advisors. Beware, one of them will destroy you and your world.

What kind of president would you make?

boardgame.name: Quadrax
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Using two characters at logical locations should advance you to the next level.

The difference between the ZX Spectum version and the DOS version is mainly the amount of levels. The ZX Spectrum version has 50 levels and the DOS version has 100.

boardgame.name: BattleCON: Himel Nine
boardgame.description:
Himel Nine, the newest member of the BattleCON roster, is an invincible hulk with supercharged weapons. His UA, Invincible Armor, reduces incoming damage down to 1, allowing him to shrug off even the most powerful attacks in the game with impunity.

Invincible Armor can be removed by moving past Himel, and it is also removed whenever Himel moves. This paradox leads to many critical moments where Himel needs to out-speed or out-slow the opponent, and must consider his foe's options carefully.

Himel also has a unique and colorful personality, which comes out on many of his cards.

boardgame.name: Lost Island
Missing on Lost Island
Verschollen auf Lost Island
Ztracený ostrov
boardgame.description:
User Summary

As Tim and Diana walk home one night they meet a couple of men dressed like 17th century pirates busy loading some stuff unto a cart - as they are seen by the men one of them shoots Diana with a laser gun making him vanish. Tim also gets shot during the fight and disappears too, but into a different period - naked and into a pit. Now he needs to find Diana and get back - but first he needs to get dressed!

boardgame.name: Treasures of the Troll King
boardgame.description:
publisher blurb


Galgenbeck is palimpsest. Tumour. A city built on the ruins of itself. Beneath the sewers the bones of the old city fester.
The troll-king Niduk was exiled, driven into the depths to rot and die. Now twisted by hatred and rage he oversees the small domain he has carved for himself, in a forgotten chapel to a murdered god.
Why are you here? A lost bet? A doomed quest for silver? Boredom?
Does it even matter?


Treasures Of The Troll King: a MÖRK BORG Adventure is an RPG sewer-crawl adventure by Chris Bissette, with art by Johan Nohr.

Treasures Of The Troll King is an adventure designed for one- or two-shot play.

The adventure takes place in two phases - a point crawl through the sewers beneath Galgenbeck in search of the sunken chapel that houses Niduk, the Troll King, and a location-based dungeon in the chapel itself.

During the adventure characters might encounter:

A pile of forgotten wishes at the base of a wishing well
The Church of Forgotten Things, a sewer shrine to the discarded treasures of everyday life kept by a strange old man who has forgotten daylight
The finger collector, a strange denizen of the sewers who trades in digits
A forgotten god sealed inside the bells of the chapel, begging for release


You'll find a host of weird locations, harrowing creatures, and new Occult Treasures and Scrolls to drop into your game.

boardgame.name: The God Of Many Faces
boardgame.description:
publisher blurb


In the gutters of Galgenbeck, in the shadow of the Cathedral of the Two Headed Basilisks, rumours spread like cancer.
A new prophet whispers blasphemies to those who will listen. Verhu is a fraud; the Calendar of Nechrubel is a sham; the Miseries have been caused by the Basilisks themselves. HE and SHE must die and a new god must replace them - the God of Many Faces, The Eternally Open Eye, Truth-Seer. THEM.


The God Of Many Faces is an independent production by Chris Bissette/Loot The Room and is not affiliated with Ockult Örtmästare Games or Stockholm Kartell. It is published under the MÖRK BORG Third Party License.

boardgame.name: King Fridge
boardgame.description:
King Fridge is a fast & strategic card game with toxic tortillas, panic pancakes and more......

All players start with four fridge cards face down in front of them, of which two may be seen once. Players take turns drawing new fridge cards, and optionally swapping them for their own. Using actions and special cards, every player tries to collect fridge cards holding dishes with low scores, while getting rid of the ones with high scores. Annoying allergies create an extra challenge! You can get an edge by being alert and sabotaging other players.

Once you are convinced the fridge cards in front of you hold a lower total score than the other players’, you may claim King Fridge. A wrongful claim will be penalized, while legitimate claims get rewarded. The player with the lowest total score after three rounds is crowned the true King Fridge.

For more information on how to play, visit www.kingfridgegame.com

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Hekpriest
boardgame.description:
publisher blurb

In the Dusk of the Sixth Penumbral Eon, one man stood alone against the infernal hordes of the Dark Lord. Their rage, infinite. Their will, indomitable. They walk the path of eternal war, never stopping in their battle against the demons and the Six Archfiends that rule over that blasted dominion. One by one, each member of the Damned Court fell by their hand. Now, the thrones of our realm lay bare, whispering to those who desire power over the ever-expanding, ever-blasphemous planes of...

Hek.

Hekpriest is a hack of Lasers & Feelings under the Creative Commons License. 2-6 players are dark priests of the demon realms of Hek, with a GM playing the part of all the infernal NPCs they'll come across. The players are trying to ascend the Black Thrones after the Six Archfiends were brutally slain by the savior of humanity, the MURDER STAR MARINE. As priests, you will command legions of demons, invade the mortal planes and besiege humanity's fortresses and other forms of shenanigans.

Beware though, causing too much demonic havoc may have the MURDER STAR MARINE turn their eyes, and guns, upon you and send you to your DOOM. Also if you stray too far back to your old human ways, the Dark Lord of Hek themself might disapprove of your actions and cast GLOOM upon you!

Go forth and raise Hek, priests...

boardgame.name: Word Royale
boardgame.description:
Are you smart and quick enough to win at Word Royale?

Grab up to 8 humans and jump into this quick, fun, and challenging game! This game will keep you on your toes and put you on the spot. Quick thinking will give you an advantage while playing Word Royale.

First flip over a category and then you have 5 seconds to say a word that is related to the category that starts with any of your letter cards!

Nothing comes to mind?
You are eliminated!

Last person standing wins the round!

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Europa Universalis 4 - Leviathan
Europa Universalis IV - Leviathan
Europa Universalis IV: Leviathan
boardgame.description:
In Europa Universalis IV: Leviathan expansion, you get new tools to centralize and accumulate power for your country. New diplomatic actions give you the means to go up against mightier counterparts and new economic tools will allow you to establish rich vassal empires that draw wealth and development to your monumental capital city.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: ASL Comp: French Algeria – Djebel Fighters 1954-1962
boardgame.description:
It is high time that YOUR tactical-level gaming IQ be put to the test in some of the roughest terrain every fought over in this contest of European will and North African stealth ...
long before the West truly grasped the capabilities of a new kind of foe.
This brings more never before published CH military art to the fore, as the ALN and post Indochina French paratroopers slug it out...in a never-ending battle that lasted until 1962.

—description from the publisher

Scenarios:

Jump on the Traitors - Besbessa Mechta, July 3rd 1956
End of a Convoy - Northwest of Oum-Ali, November 29th 1956
Operation 423 - Oued-Adb-er-Rahmane, May 21st 1957
No Time To Talk - Djebel Ouasta, January 11th 1958
Chased Through the Woods - Beni-Mezzeline Forest, February 14th 1958
Are These Harkis? - Beni-Mezzeline Forest, February 14th 1958
Dropped Into Hell - Djebel Mouadjene, south of Souk-Ahras, April 29th 1958
In the Swirling Mass - Djebel Mouadjene, south of Souk-Ahras, April 29th 1958
Cross Border Retaliation - Djebel Harraba, Tunisian Border, May 26th 1959
After the Cease-fire - Near Boualam, April 14th 1962

boardgame.name: Motif Action Engine
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Motif Action Engine is a modular RPG system toolkit:

Core 3d6 oracle system.
Alternative interpretations for the success and strength dice.
2 main flavors and 3 additional example flavors.
Skillset and core stat variants.
Resource "stone" character patch
Character ties and contacts patch
Consequences patches for both personal blows and social outcomes.
Story character patch with an NPC template system
Light rules for action scenes and hits/conditions, but no distinct "combat system". All conflicts are treated equally with player-facing rolls and common sense consequences.

boardgame.name: Motif Character Engine
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Motif Character Engine is a modular character and player emulator:

Relies on a series of "templates" and characteristics to help seed behavior.
Uses a simple backbone of 3d6 rolls.
Mix and match "flavors" to produce a wide variety of behavior and action results.
Ask questions about characters just as you would ask a player or story narrator.
Simple results and lists that drive your story without getting in the way.
Extensible, easily hacked and reskinned for a variety of genres and play styles.

boardgame.name: Winter Queen: Mini-Expansion Set
boardgame.description:
Mini-expansions set expand your experience of Winter Queen and consists of 3 fully compatible mini-expansions that you may use with the game.

This set includes:

• Gratitudes mini-expansion:

This mini-expansion increases player interaction and competitiveness of Winter Queen. We recommend playing your first games without it, though. Gratitudes, when you’re ready to use them, will let you experience a new layer of strategy.

At the beginning of the game, you receive 5 Gratitude tokens. Each of them corresponds to one of the crystal colors. When you place a crystal on a Queendom Map board, you flip the Gratitude token of the corresponding color face up, thus activating it. From now on, you may use it. Each token grants you a special one-time ability. When the token is used, it flips face down... until you retrieve it again by placing the crystal of its color on the Map board. Each Gratitude token is a very powerful tool if used wisely. For example, green token allows you to swap any 2 Queen’s Domain tiles on the Map board, and red one can replace up to 3 crystals on the Crystal Holder tiles.

• Royal Jewelry mini-expansion:

This expansion adds a whole new level of strategy. In the base game, crystals from the Spell Books you activate are discarded. Royal Jewelry gives these crystals a second life. After you activate a Spell Book, instead of discarding crystal(s), you move them to your Royal Jewelry card. You may choose to put crystal(s) in the Treasury or add it to your Tiara. At the end of the game the Treasury generates 1 VP for every 2 crystals in it, and The Tiara can generate up to insane 10 VPs!

• Great Wizard solo mini-expansion:

What do wizards do when there are no other wizards to compete with? Well, they perform special quests for their Queen! This solo mini-expansion is fully compatible with other mini-expansions and allows you to experience almost the same gameplay even when there are no other wizards around.

When you play solo, replace common Spell Books with 8 special ones and remove all but 20 crystals from the game. Create patterns out of enchanted crystals as usual and do your best to score as many VPs as possible. Compare your result with the chart and measure your success on a scale from a mere Charlatan to a truly Great Wizard!

boardgame.name: Barrage: Metal Coins
boardgame.description: Metal coins designed for Barrage board game.

boardgame.name: Bezzerwizzer Bricks: Litterära klassiker
boardgame.description:
BEZZERWIZZER Bricks is a series of small quiz packages in a variety of subjects. The game is a perfect gift for the football fan, fantasy nerd or movie lover.

Have you also cried for Gösta Berling and Don Quixote and laughed with Madicken and d’Artagnan? Have you followed Raskolnikov through St. Petersburg and Heathcliff out into the heath? Here is the quiz for all of us who have Camus, Christie and Kipling on the shelf.

boardgame.name: Monsters and the Things That Destroy Them
boardgame.description:
A memory and bluffing game featuring monster cards from classic literature (plus some modern ones like "hunk vampire" and "teen wolf") and the neutralizer cards that can destroy them. Each monster has an ability such as triggering the top card of your discard pile. You don't play cards from your hand; you take cards from a 4-card pool and trigger the card as you take it. At the end of the game players discard down to their best 2 cards. Neutralizers then destroy their corresponding monsters, and the player with the best surviving combination of cards wins.

GOAL
End the game with the highest combined point total between your final 2 cards.

SETUP
Shuffle all cards and deal 4 face-up into the center row (the Pool), and one face- down into each player’s personal discard pile. At any time, players may look at (but not rearrange) their discard pile. Choose a random “start player” to begin.

EACH PLAYER’S TURN (proceed clockwise)
Draw a card from the Pool, say its name and number aloud, and trigger/resolve its primary ability. (If another card gets triggered, reveal it and resolve it.) Fill the Pool back to 4 from the face-down deck.

At the end of your turn, if you exceed your hand limit (3 cards), discard excess cards face-down to your discard pile. When the draw deck is empty, continue taking turns until everyone has had an equal number. Then Resolution begins.

NEUTRALIZER CARDS
These do nothing when drawn/triggered; instead they are used during Resolution. Most Neutralizers negate the points granted by 2 specific Monsters (in any players’ hands). Neutralizers are not Monsters; their points can’t be negated.

RESOLUTION (combine / score your 2 cards)
All players discard down to just 2 cards. In turn order, each player dramatically reveals their highest-number card. Then they reveal their other card. Resolve all Neutralizers. The player with the highest total score wins the game. If there is a tie, the tied player with the highest-value surviving Monster is the winner.

—description from publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Monsters and the Things That Destroy Them: Attack of the Baby Koalas
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Monsters and the Things That Destroy Them: The Dead
Monsters and the Things That Destroy Them: The Deep

boardgame.name: Conus Wabantus
boardgame.description:
The game consists of two game boards, five big and many smaller ceramic cones.
One board is the actual playing field. The central nine spaces hold small cones at the beginning. The active player rolls the five big cones and places them on the second board. Upright cones go in the center, the other cones are go around it, depending on where their tip pointed after rolling. The player then turns the board into the desired alignment and makes their move. All pieces have to remain connected at least diagonally. A piece moves into the direction of the cone tip, jumping over all other connected pieces in front of it (like in Reinhold Wittig's old game Wabanti, which inspired the name). An upright cone means placing a new cone in the central area, a second upright cone means removing a piece anywhere.
The winner is the first player who has a piece leave the game board on their side.

boardgame.name: Leaping Letters
boardgame.description:
The librarian has locked up all the "naughty books" in the library. The books have to make three-letter words that match patterns to collect library cards. The book with the most library cards gets a key card. Five key cards lets the book escape.

OVERVIEW

Using letters on the cards in your hand and the common “community” cards, form three-letter words in a specific pattern. These patterns are found on each letter card.

Play in rounds, collecting library cards and exchanging them for keys. At the start of each round, return all the library cards to a common pile. On each turn, a player can perform one action:

Use one of their letter cards to form a word -or-
Exchange one letter card and immediately play it if possible


After forming a word, collect a library card worth the value of the word formed. Count the point value of the word formed and grab a library card of equal value. Most letters are worth 1 point, a few worth 2 points and X and Z worth 3 points.

When one player eliminates all their cards, the round is over. The person with the most library card points will get a key. If there is a tie, all tied players get a key. Once all the keys have been dispensed or one player has collected five keys, the player with the most keys wins.

SOLO GAME PLAY
Deal three community cards. Deal yourself ten letter cards. Attempt to use all of your cards to form words. You are allowed a maximum of three exchanges. Win by playing all cards.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: POW!: Alternate dice
boardgame.description: Blue and orange dice, to replace the dice of the base game.

boardgame.name: Manstein's War: Decision in the West 1940
boardgame.description:
Manstein's War: Decision in the West 1940 is a two-player wargame of the German offensive in Western Europe in May-June 1940 in which the Wehrmacht seized a stunning victory over Allied forces in the Low Countries and France. The game uses a variant of the Boots system to model command, control, and logistics on an operational scale. Both players can fight a campaign of mobility and decisive battles.

The general structure of the game is that each player uses command markers to activate their forces, which are divided into sub-commands (army groups and similar echelons). Each player has special markers which provide additional operational capabilities. Can you turn the tide of history in that decisive spring of 1940?

Components: 22x34 inch map, 176 die-cut counters.

World at War #84, June 2022

—description from publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: They Died With Their Boots On (Decision Games)

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Budapest Campaign: October 1944 to February 1945
boardgame.description:
Budapest Campaign: October 1944 to February 1945 is a wargame of the Soviet offensive in Hungary in late 1944 and early 1945 which culminated in the conquest of the city of Budapest. Throughout this campaign the Axis launched successive counterattacks which regained ground but, in the end, failed to stem the Soviet tide.

There are two players: Axis and Soviets. Each side is divided into sub-commands. For the Axis, this includes Armee Kommando Nord, Armee Kommando Sud (these are not historical designators but are based on German operational practice by this period), and Hungarian forces. The Soviets have Second and Third Ukrainian Fronts, as well as the Romanian army.

Budapest Campaign ends just prior to the start of Spring Awakening (World at War #73) which covers the final German offensive on the Eastern Front. Both games use a variant of the DG Boots system to model command/control and logistics. Various command markers activate player sub-commands and launch major offensives.

Components: 22x34 inch map, 176 die-cut counters.

World at War #85 August 2022

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Netherlands East Indies: 1941 to 1942
boardgame.description:
Netherlands East Indies: 1941 to 1942 is an operational wargame of the campaign in 1941-42 in which the Japanese seized control of the Dutch colonial empire in the South Pacific. NEI is a combined naval-air-land campaign, in which operational capabilities can be decisive. The game system shows the effects of various operations over the course of a scenario. Players conduct Actions which encompass discrete combat, logistical, intelligence and other operations. A player can conduct one or more Actions per turn. All units in the game use a similar combat system. The system shows the interaction of naval, air and land forces. At stake: the resources of the South Seas and the gateways to the Indian Ocean and Australia.

Components: 22x34 inch map, 176 die-cut counters.

World at War Magazine #87, December 2022

boardgame.name: Rush Out!: Dice Trays
boardgame.description: Rush Out! Dice Trays (Dimensions 20 x 20 x 0.5 cm)

boardgame.name: The Magic Shop Catalogue
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Magic Shop Catalogue is a system agnostic book that brings 16 ready-to-play dynamic magic shops, each based on a unique and flavorful concept. Each shop brings its own items, engaging NPC, customers, and adventure hooks, and is easily inserted into almost ANY TTRPG system. Don't let these amazing roleplaying and adventure opportunties pass you buy... shop our shop catologue today!

This product includes:

- Abra Cadavra: A shop specializing in necromancy and other "after death" services.

- Armored Mighty Morphs: Dealing in special armor for shapeshifters and shapeshifting training!

- Beaurgahleigh's: A spa, club, and boutique for the fashionable and elite.

- A Bloody Good Time: If you want to become an undead, this family run business can help you do so responsibly.

- Boutique de Bellisima: "If you want to be fashionable while you adventure, Bellisima Boutique is the place to be."

- Imra's Immortal Implements: Your "contract" specialist... and items from people who defaulted on their promises.

- The Interplanar Bazaar: Filled with items from all over the multiverse!

- Kaikori's Treasures: This shop, run by a forest spirit, has a knack for knowing exactly what you need.

- Leinad's Pop-up Shop: This shop can appear *anywhere* as long as you know the magic words to summon it.

- Lyn's Portal of Amphibious Delights: This shop is set inside a giant, migrating frog, and is attended to by her tadpole children.

- Pawn's: You can find just about anything at this unusual shop, run by the owner Pawn, his mage assistant, and a weird sentient book... named Book.

- Phenomenal Plants: The one-stop shop for all your mundane and magical plant needs. Don't mind the lost treant.

- Reflections in Mystery: In a shop full of mirrors, you'll be attended to by... yourself, or at least a better-looking version of yourself.

- Sweet Sister's Shop: These three hag sisters create the most deliciously devious sweets. Buy a scrumptious goody for any occaision.

- The Tear & Wear: This shop set inside a giant wondering husk of a monster is perfect for the gruff and buff adventurer looking for some extra oomph.

- The Tower of Time: Half buried beneath the sand, find all your time related needs and services inside!

boardgame.name: Jump Off: The game for horse lovers
boardgame.description:
The Jump Off board represents an equestrian show-jumping arena. The board is a hex grid.

Players set out 18 jumps to make their own course for the horses to jump over. Six player pieces are included in the box, but more players can play by adding their own pieces. The game includes trivia cards with equestrian-related questions. The questions are divided into six difficulty levels for players to decide what they want to study. Four of the levels are designed to help the player prepare for the British Horse Society exams (Stage 1 to stage 4), and the game is associated with the British Horse Society.

The players move and answer questions to go over the jumps. The first player to the end of the course wins. Special cards also affect the players' progression.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Noten-Würfel
boardgame.description:
The players try to form permissible note rows with 10 dice on which notes instead of numbers are shown in a maximum of 3 rolls. For each die that could not be used, one of the 45 question cards must be answered. Plus points are awarded for valid rows of dice and correctly answered questions, minus points for incorrectly answered questions. The player with the most points wins.

Noten-Würfel can be played in teams or with 2-4 players.

boardgame.name: Savaged Pardners Vol. 5
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Western Pre-Gens!

This fifth volume of Savaged Pardners contains six (6) pre-generated Wild Card templates, ready for use in any Savage Worlds Western game, along with four (4) Extra designs.

The Wild Cards can be used by players as the heroes of an adventure, or they could become nonplayer adversaries. The four Extras are most likely to make an appearance in town, but there's no tellin' where they may turn up. The Dog House Gang reckons it's a cinch for the Judge (that’s GM to city slickers) to introduce these characters.

Vol. 5 includes six Legendary rank Wild Cards with eighteen Advances each, and four Novice Extras with one Advance each.

Sleuth (WC)
Mastermind (WC)
Shootist (WC)
Comanche Rider (WC)
Desperado (WC)
Mountain Main (WC)
Carpenter, Hostler, Locksmith, Newspaper Crier (Extras)

boardgame.name: Awake in the Night Sky
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

> Why am I here? Where is here?

>Power core lost. They took it. They took my eyes.

>Agents to sleep. Batteries low, shutting down.

>Drifting now. Listen. Wait.

>Awake in the night sky I wait for those who will follow.

>I will be free.

Awake in the Night Sky is an exploration and investigation Starfinder adventure designed to begin around level 3 with advancement to level 6 by the very end. It takes place first aboard a forgotten spire of the central station before heading out into the outer deeps on the edge of known space. From the writer of the acclaimed Fall of Whitecliff, playtested with rigour, with cartography by the excellent Maciek Zagorski, Coldlight Press is now delighted to bring you another great adventure, this time in the science fantasy romp of a system that is Starfinder.

boardgame.name: Alert! All Hands On Deck: Fleet Expansion
boardgame.description:
Add a new fleet to your game with this expansion for Alert: All Hands on Deck (required for play).

Adds

5 new ships.
An optional Create Fleet Deck rule.
Special abilities are free now but you remove the active threat card from the game.


Create Fleet Deck
Instead of putting ships by the modifier value, pick any 3 ships and their order in the fleet deck.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Przeklęta Ziemia
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Control a mercenary in the hunt for three precious crystals on the planet Cursed Earth.

The game is similar to Syndicate.
boardgame.videogameversion: European/Polish DOS CD-ROM Fajna Seria re-release

boardgame.name: The Big Book of Characters Volume 16
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Grab a set of percentile dice (d100) to give a random character or you can find a character at the correct level for your adventure.
...
Oftentimes we find ourselves sitting around the table, with a set adventure path before our players, and the inevitable happens. One player is unprepared for the session or is in need of a new character.

No problem.

El gran libro de los personajes PDF
Le grand livre des personnages PDF
Il grande libro dei personaggi PDF
O Grande Livro dos Personagens PDF
Das große Buch der Charaktere PDF
Het grote boek met karakters PDF
キャラクターの大本 PDF

boardgame.name: Dungeon Module CH2: The Temple of Zeus (Revised)
Dungeon Module R1: The Temple of Zeus
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventure Module CH2 continues the adventures of CH1 The King's Castle. In this adventure, the heroes enter the Undercity and explore what is there. The first being The Temple of Zeus. On the way they will me some new friends for enemies like Raven Tophat.
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: Stimulus
boardgame.description:
Stimulus is the first Italian board game designed for adults. Spicy, provocative and played as a team.

The goal is to reach the finish line on the board first. To do this, your team will have to draw, mimic and overcome unexpected events that will reveal your most secret sides.

There are two modes:

Classic - risque enough for 95% of the population
Party - only for the most daring, ready to drink one glass too many

When to play Stimulus: college parties, bachelor parties, bachelorette parties, pre-evening and any other occasion when your parents aren't around ...

How to Play Stimulus

Open the game table, take the decks of cards and place them face down on the game table. Players divide into teams of at least 2 people. Each team chooses a pawn and defines the captain for the first round. The most excited team starts by rolling the die and moving their pawn on the board.

The captain draws the card that corresponds to the color of the square you arrived at. He looks at the word on the card, and passes it discreetly to the designers of the other teams. It's time to draw. Once all the designers have seen the card, the countdown 3,2,1 starts, GO!

The other members of each team will have to guess the artwork of their designers. The first team to guess wins the round. The winning team rolls the die and repeats steps 4 - 6.

Includes rules for drinking game version as well.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Freibeuter
boardgame.description:
Trading game back to the time of sailing ships and the great port cities as a transshipment point for all goods of this earth - but beware of the pirates, you do not want to lose the precious cargo.

Transporting goods from port to port brings more revenue the longer the distance. There are 2 ways to earn ducats, either from your own cargo or from the cargo of your fellow players, which you take from them with the help of the buccaneers. The routes are always determined anew, if a ship has reached a target port, thereby one can equip a ship also again. Each ship must be moved once per turn, the range depends on the wind.

A game turn consists of influencing wind direction, setting buccaneer courses, moving merchant ships, moving buccaneers, passing a marker. The winner is the first to reach the agreed ducat sum e.g. 10,000.

boardgame.name: ZAC!
boardgame.description:
A fun and stimulating game for the whole family, to practice attention skills, train speed reflexes and stimulate the memory.

In the ZAC family hut, somewhere in the Far West, no one ever stands still! The animals, and even the plants, change position from one moment to the next. Sometimes they are there and sometimes they are hidden. Don’t be fooled, the landscape and the house are always the same but all around goats, horses, tools, and buckets move! Where did they leave the wheelbarrow? And where did the bison go?

You need to have hawk eyes and cat-like reflexes to be able to spot all the elements every time and beat your opponents: at the end of the game who will be the fastest draw in the West?

The game features landscape cards, scoreboard tokens and 36 cards. Each player must get as many tokens as possible to win the game. But, you only have 30 seconds to look at your landscape card and locate the 12 elements on it!

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Cookie Contest
boardgame.description:
The goal of this strategic card game is to make a delicious cookie for as many famous food judges as possible.

The object of the game is to score the highest total number of points.

Players earn points when they make a cookie for a judge.

Players lose points when a judge does not receive a cookie before the end of the game.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: まじかる☆パティスリー (Magical Patisserie)
boardgame.description:
Each player is in charge of producing a type of sweet, but they dont know what!
Deduce from what your opponent's have made and try to bluff them into thinking they are in charge of something else.

Players are given a card that they cannot see, that is the type of sweet they want to make more of.
Each round, players may play magic cards for various effects, afterwhich they must make a sweet.
After making five sweets, the round ends. Players score 2 points for sweets of their type, 1 for their opponent's types, and -2 if they make the Maestro's sweets.
