Game ends when a certain amount of points have been accumulated, whoever has the most points is the winner.

—user summary

boardgame.name: イチからファーム (Ichikara Farm)
boardgame.description:
Micro deck building game where you try to build the best farm possible.

Players start as a rancher (a single card).
Each turn you play as many cards as you want (hand limit is 3) and then make a purchase and rinse and repeat.
Game ends when the purchase deck is exhausted.

Players deck out their farm with ranches and flower fields (which produces more gold), or with animals like monkeys and deer that help to steal from your opponents.
Hiring carpenters and hunters will help you to grow your wealth faster or to prevent the opponent's animals from creating mischief in your farm.

Accumulate enough gold to build attractions or a zoo to earn precious victory points!

—user summary

boardgame.name: Classic Car
boardgame.description:
Classic Car is similar to Monopoly. Here you don't collect roads but cars to earn money with them. The players roll their figures over a circuit, can acquire possession cards and must accept events (losses and profits). Some fields (e.g. the foreclosure, the restoration) intervene more strongly in the possession than one is used to from Monopoly. There are several ways the game ends:

A player gives up
A player shows a joker card, hoping to have the most money at the moment.
An agreed playing time is over


In any case, the richest player wins.

boardgame.name: ExeCUTEtion
boardgame.description:
ExeCUTEtion is the card game of adorable capital punishment, and is for 2-6 players. Do away with your friends and don’t get deadified!

Maybe take out your friends with the help of a happy little Electrocution, or maybe with an innocuous Drowning? Hanging? What about Burying Them Alive? Drawn and Quartered? Impalement? All these, and more in ExeCUTEtion!

2-6 players have three rounds to attempt to take each other out by playing various adorable execution cards in front of each other. Whoever has the least amount of points after the third round, wins!

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Seven Demons
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Seven Demons is a supplement for Evil Hat's Fate system, providing seven NPC demons that can be used as dangerous foes or tempting allies for your adventuring party. Although designed with a fantasy lens, this collection of dark spirits can easily be adapted to other genres and settings.

Seven Demons is also designed to work in tandem with:

- The Great Demon-Goat, a system neutral, one-shot adventure.
- Heartbreaker, a pamphlet-sized fantasy FATE game.

boardgame.name: Autka
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Top-down racing game similar to Micro Machines (1991).

A part of the Polish video game compilation 3w1: Autka, Dark Moon, Mr. Tomato from June 1996 and individually published in February 1997.
boardgame.videogameversion: European/Polish DOS CD-ROM cover mount release

boardgame.name: Dark Moon
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Side scrolling space shooter.

Originally a part of the compilation 3w1: Autka, Dark Moon, Mr. Tomato from June 1996, but individually published in 1999 as a cover mount.
boardgame.videogameversion: European/Polish DOS CD-ROM cover mount edition

boardgame.name: Mr. Tomato
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Similar to Bubba 'n' Stix.
The player character is trapped in a comic book and the goal is to escape it by collecting coins. You can shoot enemies by throwing tomatoes at them.
boardgame.videogameversion: European/Polish DOS CD-ROM Cover Mount edition

boardgame.name: 3w1: Autka, Dark Moon, Mr. Tomato
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Compilation of three games from LK Avalon.
boardgame.videogameversion: European/Polish DOS CD-ROM Fajna Seria edition

boardgame.name: Beethoven
boardgame.description:
Players collect tiles from the Lifeometer to compose the best symphony they can. Meanwhile, their movement around the Clock dial translates to the fifty-six years of Beethoven's life. When one player completes their symphony, composing enters the final stages before scoring in the Veneration (of Beethoven's life).

The game has three distinct game levels (Early, Middle and Late Periods) and scoring develops in each game, Players score points for the qualities of their symphony; the most points wins the game.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Dark Spires
boardgame.description:
Dark Spires is a small box 2-player abstract strategy game. A ring of 8 realm cards form the playing area.

Players will summon their spire dice onto these cards and move them around the ring in an attempt to block and banish their opponent's spires while resurrecting their own. If your opponent is unable to either move or summon on their turn, you win!

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Unearthed Adventures Volume: II
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unearthed Adventures Volume 2 is a collection of six professionally written one-page adventures for 5th Edition D&D. They are designed to be modular, so they can be tossed into an ongoing RPG campaign or run as a single adventure. They're easily expanded upon to fit every Game Master's playstyle.

boardgame.name: Skaut Kwatermaster
boardgame.description:
User Summary

As you are at a scout summer camp next to an old army base a Girl Guide gets trapped inside a rusty, old tank - you now have to rescue her from it.
boardgame.videogameversion: European/Polish DOS CD-ROM cover mount edition
European/Polish DOS CD-ROM Fajna Seria edition

boardgame.name: Strip Puzzle
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Puzzle game for adults. There are three difficulty levels of 25 or 64 puzzles to play through.

boardgame.name: Nostalgia [DOS]
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Nostalgically gloomy story where you are going to see you father for the first time since your divorce.

boardgame.name: War Room: Nano-Expansion 'Take Her Down'
boardgame.description:
20 chipboard tokens with 2 new rule systems:

DIVED SUBMARINES

The Dived Submarine side is used to mark Submarines that escaped combat by diving after they are returned to the World Map. These escaped dived subs can then avoid pinning and immediately move to an adjacent sea region.

CONVOY CASUALTIES

The Convoy Casualty side is used to mark sunk convoy ships on the Morale Board. Each sunk convoy is worth 6 casualty points.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Movie Mind
Mr Troove
boardgame.description:
With your team, dive into the scenery, scrutinize the smallest detail and try to answer the 5 questions in time to earn as many points as possible. Questions are divided up to match the colors if each player/team and a bonus question can be answered that awards the whole 5 points at once.

800 films to be found through more than 1000 questions covering all cinematographic styles: Ghostbusters, Interstellar, The Silence of the Lambs, Shrek, The Fabulous Destiny of Amélie Poulain and more.

The player/team with the most points at the end of the game wins.

boardgame.name: D-Day to Berlin: Six Panzer Armee – Scenario 1: The Battle of the Bulge
boardgame.description:
6th Panzer Armee is a two or more player scenario for D-Day to Berlin depicting the northern shoulder of Hitler’s surprise attack Wacht am Rhein.
This was located in the Ardennes in December,1944, commonly known as the Battle of the Bulge.

In this scenario the area of concentration is roughly from Monschau to just north of St. Vith, from December 16th to the 19th, 1944 when the German attack still had a chance to cross the Meuse.

This scenario includes:

Customized Map
Order of Battle for both Allied and German forces
Special rules for the scenario
New rules for D-Day to Berlin


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: First Victories: Wellington versus Napoleon
boardgame.description:
First game in the The Glory and Empire series.

Glory and Empire is a fresh look at grand tactical command, maneuver and combat during the French Revolutionary and Napoleonic Period. The system is focused on command, maneuver and combat that is fast playing, yet accurate and rich with detail.

The game is 125m per hex. Units are battalions and companies for infantry, regiments and squadrons for cavalry and companies for artillery. Each strength point is 100 men for infantry, 50 men and horses for cavalry or one section, or 2 guns, for artillery. Counters are 5/8".

The rules consist of a Soldier's, Battalion and Brigade rules set. Players can learn the basics with the Soldier's rules, move to a full fledged simulation with the Battalion Game and pick and choose rules from the Brigade Game to suit their tastes. Or players can jump right into the Brigade Game and understand how grand tactical maneuvering was practiced on the battlefield during the 18th and 19th centuries.

The Soldier's Game gives players new to the era an introduction to foundational concepts of tactics in the horse and musket era. In the Soldier's and Battalion Games there are the usual Line, Column, Square and skirmishers. The Battalion game has two types of Skirmishers, introduces important concepts for maneuvering forces on the battlefield and has more detailed close combat procedures. The Brigade Game adds close columns, attack columns, closed square, Austrian division masses. Artillery is simplified for the Soldier's and Battalion Games, but the Battalion Game adds artillery ammunition. The Brigade Game adds bombardment zones, bounce through, howitzer fire and separate ammunition tracking for round shot, shell, canister and shrapnel. The Brigade Game also gives players more tools to react to enemy moves.

The piece de resistance of the Brigade Game are the command rules. Players choose to form their brigades into Grand Columns or Lines of Battle. To deploy for battle the player must decide which evolution to use to form Line of Battle and shake his men into fighting order. To cross a bridge or move through a defile in the face of the enemy will take careful planning to avoid being embarrassed by the enemy when the columns emerge on the other side. Keeping the troops in good order is all important if the day is to be won.

The system will make its debut with Lock 'n Load publishing, featuring Wellington's first victories against Napoleon's forces in the Peninsula, with the battles of Roliça and Vimeiro. If all goes well we'll follow it up with Fuentes de Oñoro and Salamanca.

Play Glory and Empire and learn the trade of fighting a Napoleonic period battle and earn your marshal's baton.

Facebook Page

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Horses and Ponies
boardgame.description:
This is a re-implementation of classic Monopoly, where players buy and develop sections of the board as they pass. In this game, the places on the board are horse breeds, and the player can build stalls and stables to develop their purchased sections of the board.

Board comes with special player tokens: Riding boot, Horseshoe, Feed bucket, Wheel barrow, Jockey cap, Horse brush.

boardgame.name: Come on! Bite me!
丛林大冒险
你咬我啊！
森林之王
boardgame.description:
Survival in the jungle is full of challenges! Facing the prey, shout out: "Come On! Bite me!"

In the game, each player will draw role cards to play as different animals, hunters, or bacteria. In each turn, you have to choose the time to attack or call on more friends to besiege or change your role card, or you can just do nothing and skip your turn. After the player's role is defeated or if he actively chooses to change the card, he can draw a new role card.

When the player is playing a big animal, you always want to attack animals that are the same as you or smaller, so that you can get more points. When you are unfortunately playing a small animal, don’t rush to change cards, because you can start a besiege and have a chance to get the loots.

This is a challenging and exciting game for multi-people parties. During the game, you will randomly play with various wild animals, hunters, and even bacteria. All you have to do is to live as long as possible and win each battle. When the game is over, the player with the most points wins!

—user summary

boardgame.name: Derby
boardgame.description:
Derby is a competitive card game that puts players in the role of horse race gamblers. Everyone will try to maximize their profits through clever handling of the information they have: their cards. These are used to determine the value of bets and, during the race, for the different horses to advance in their lanes.

The objective of the game is to be the bettor with the most victory points after all the races. You bet on a horse, secretly, and do what you can to get it in the position that gives you the most points. You score points in each race by taking the prizes from the common chip pool and also your private bet card if you bet on the winning horse.

The player with the most points at the end of the 5 races is the winner.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Professor Noggin's Horse
boardgame.description:
The game is a trivia contest between the players. Players roll the dice to see who will answer first. Then, the next player draws a card and rolls the dice to see which trivia question to ask of several available questions. If the first player correctly answers the question, they get to keep the card for the rest of the game. The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Châteauguay
boardgame.description:
To win, you must connect at least three board sides with your counters. To place counters on the board, you must win tricks whose cards correspond to tiles on the board, which are randomly distributed before the start of the game.

However, you have a limited number of counters. If you've played all of your counters and haven't created a winning formation with your counters, you lose!

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: HorsePLAY
boardgame.description:
HorsePLAY involves action, challenges, answering trivia, miming, drawing, and possibly singing. The game involves a set of cards in a box, along with a timer, a die, and pencil and paper.

A player draws a card, and reads the action or question to the player whose turn it is. The kinds of actions each card can be are: Champion (high point-value questions with visual clues), Gallery (questions involving a picture), Crossroad (deciding between two scenarios), Trivia/Busking/Adventure (roll to see if you are asked a trivia question, or must perform an action) and Brain Teaser (answer a riddle).

The actions are worth varying amounts of points. The scorekeeper records the points, and the winner is whoever has the most points when the players decide to end the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Geek Out! The 00s Edition
boardgame.description:
Geek Out! is the game of mind-challenging fun that finds out once and for all which player is the reigning geek authority on your favorite geeky pop culture subjects!

In the game, you will draw cards asking you to list things which fall under a certain category. Before you begin, however, the other players may try to steal your points (and bragging rights!), by bidding to list even more than the card requires. The bidding continues until one player is ready to “out-geek” their friends and family.

Geek Out! the 00’s Edition will have you and your friends geeking out and feeling nostalgic about your favorite decade! Are you ready for this dope new edition? Woot woot!
boardgame.commerceweblink: Geek Game Shop listing for Geek Out! 00's Edition
boardgame.boardgameintegration: Geek Out! The Big Bang Theory
Geek Out! The Big Bang Theory

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: Title: Geek Out! The 00s Edition Publisher: Ultra PRO Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Our Village
boardgame.description:
Use resources to construct buildings to help your village. Each building will help a number of people in your village. The player who helps the most people is the winner!

Each turn players have the option of asking another player for a specific resource card. If the other player has that resource, they must trade it for another card from the active player's hand. If they do not have it, both players draw a card from the resource deck.

They may then construct buildings by playing sets of resource cards matching the next available building on a given pile, or upgrade an existing building (only paying the difference) if they have already built a smaller building of one of the available building cards.

The game ends when one player has built 5 buildings in their village, each other player then has one more turn. Players add up all the people their buildings have helped, the winner is the player who has the highest total.

boardgame.name: Narratore
boardgame.description:
Once upon a time ... there was a game to invent stories all together in a fun way! Whoever rearranges a sequence of cards first, tells a story inspired by the images and the structure sheet. Who has more imagination?

The structure cards are placed in the center of the table in order from 1 to 5: these will provide the players with the guide for the construction of the stories. The dealer shuffles the inspiration cards and arranges them face down and scattered on the table.

The aim of the game is to conquer a succession of cards from 1 to 5. In turn, starting with the player to the right of the dealer, each draws a card from the table until he has 5 cards each (uncovered in front of him). If no one has a sequence from 1 to 5, the game continues: each player, in turn, draws a new map and discards one in his possession, placing it face down on the table. If a player rolls a series of 1 to 5, stop the game and try to tell a story by connecting the 4 images with the final map and using the structure cards as a template (on the back of each there is a short description for each phase of the story that helps the player to create the tale). After telling the story, the other players give a score from 1 to 10 to the narrator (the votes add up and form the score of each narrator; the scores can be written on a sheet of paper). he used blankets on the bench randomly and draws five more. The game continues in the same way with the player to the right of the last narrator. Whoever gets to 100 points first (or more or less at the choice of the players) wins. Make up stories A child or adult can play alone by practicing making up stories.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Poeticamente
boardgame.description:
Do you want to try your hand at an enigmatic and creative game, for lyricists of all ages?

The winner is whoever is faster to compose a themed phrase or poem, in which the initial letters of words or verses recompose a name. (acrostic game)

The theme papers are mixed and covered in the center of the table, even in several bunches. Keep the name card and the marker close at hand. Each competitor must get some pieces of paper and a pen.

The youngest writes on the name card, in the column, the letters of a name (the chosen name must be at least 4 and maximum 9 letters and can be a personal name but also a common name of thing, person, animal, etc.). He then puts the card in the center of the table, showing it to the other players. Then he draws a theme map, places it face up next to the name card and the game begins. The first among the competitors who writes a sentence adhering to the subject of the drawn theme map, consisting of words or verses which, read in order, begin with the letters of the name of the ticket, wins the heat. If the sentence is not relevant to the theme, the second fastest player wins, and so on. The winner earns the drawn theme map. The game continues in the same way with a new round (the player following the first one in clockwise order will draw).

The winner is the one who wins the most theme maps at the end of one or two laps (at the choice of the competitors). In the event of a tie, a play-off takes place.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Proverbiamo
boardgame.description:
The most famous folk sayings become a fun and original memory game for everyone.
Put the proverbs back together and surprise your opponents by combining tiles in a new, comical and hilarious way!

Memo dei proverbi The maps are spread out and covered on the table. The youngest player begins. He discovers first a red map and then an orange map. If he manages to compose a proverb, he wins the couple and always continues in the same way, otherwise he puts the covered maps back on the table, leaving them in the same position. The game continues counterclockwise. Warning: if a competitor finds the black map, he puts all the maps he has conquered back in the middle. The game continues until there are no more maps on the table. Whoever has the most pairs wins.

Creative memo It is played the same way, but in case you discover two maps that do not form a proverb, you stop for a turn. However, this penalty can be avoided if the competitor manages to justify, with a brief and reasonable explanation, the "new" proverb that she has formed. If the motivation is accepted by the other players, the competitor does not stand still for a turn, but passes his hand and puts the covered maps back on the table. For example, “He who sleeps does not catch. .. "" a treasure "can be a new proverb because ... or" Between husband and wife do not put ... "" money "can be a new proverb because ...

—user summary

boardgame.name: Ipse Dixit
boardgame.description:
«Veni, vidi, vici», «One for all, all for one!», «I have a dream!».
Do you know the most famous aphorisms?
In this fun and original memory game for everyone, you associate each sentence with its author and discover sayings you've never heard before!

The maps are shuffled and arranged scattered and covered on the table (in an easier way the tiles can be arranged in a 6 x 8 rectangle). The youngest player first discovers a map with a black back (author) and then a map with a beige back (aphorism). If he manages to match an author with his aphorism, he earns the maps and continues to play; otherwise he covers them and the turn passes to the next competitor. The game ends when there are no more maps on the ground: the winner is the one who has earned the most author-aphorism pairs.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Sette Sfide board game box
boardgame.description:
A fun collection of strategy games in a practical format, for many one-on-one challenges, wherever you want and with whoever you want. Are you ready? Choose the game, take the marker and think about the right move!

The pack contains 7 boards on which the boards of the following classic abstract games are shown: GOMOKU - NIM - DOTS & BOXES - SNAKES - MAMMA VS PAPPA - CHINESE WALL.

GOMOKU It is an ancient strategy game also called "five in a row". The players take turns marking a square with their symbol (eg "O" and "X"). The first player to get five of their own symbols aligned, horizontally, vertically or diagonally, wins the game.

NIM It is an ancient game of unknown origins. The players take turns erasing one or more cans from a single row. They must remove at least one jar and can remove any number of cans from the same row. The last player able to move wins.

DOTS & BOXES It is a "pencil and paper" game with countless variations. How to play The two players take turns drawing horizontal or vertical lines between two adjacent points. If a player completes the fourth side of a square, he marks that square with the initial of his name (or a letter of recognition) and must immediately draw another line (as if it were an extra turn). When all squares have been filled, the player who has captured the most squares is the winner.

SNAKES It is the "pen and paper" version of an old video game. How to play It is played on a 7 x 7 point matrix. The first player starts from the green "S" point in the upper left, while the other starts with the red "S" point in the lower right, as shown in the image. Players take turns growing their snake, extending it one segment at a time by drawing a horizontal or vertical line from the previous point to an adjacent one. The first player unable to move loses.

MOM VS PAPPA It is a "pen and paper" strategy game: the aim is to recreate the word MOM for one player and the word PAPPA on the grid for the other. At the beginning of the game, the players decide who plays for PAPPA (inserting the letters P and A) and who for MOMMA (inserting the letters Me A). On his turn, the player inserts one of the two letters of his word in any box, without having to use the same letter every turn. The player who is the first to spell his word horizontally, vertically or diagonally wins the game.

CHINESE WALL is a simple and fun game. The aim is to be the last player to create a wall that spans three territories.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Saltalettera
boardgame.description:
A word game for everyone!
Move on the board by jumping from one tile to another, choose the right letters and write the longest word! A game of language skill and strategy to train the minds of young and old.

Mix the letter tiles and arrange them in the center of the table forming a 5x5 square. Each player takes a marker, a word-form board and a joker triangle. Procedure The youngest player places the black placeholder on a letter-card of his choice. Each player then chooses a letter (present in the selected tile) and writes it on their word-form board (in one of the circles). Then the next player moves the placeholder onto another letter-card adjacent to the previous one (the movement can take place by one step). The process is repeated up to that the players have not completed the six letters on their wordform board. At this point the players, within 30 seconds, must write a meaningful word using their transcribed letters. Each player will earn as many points as there are letters in the written word. The score achieved by each player must be written in the corresponding space on the scorecard. Jolly Triangle During a round, players can play the joker by placing the triangle of their color on the active letter-tile: in the word formation phase, they will be able to use a letter present in that tile an infinite number of times. New round The trailing player takes the placeholder and starts a new round in the same way as the previous one. The game continues and ends when a player reaches 20 points (or more or less at the players' choice). He will be the winner!

—user summary

boardgame.name: Idea!
boardgame.description:
Draw an original and convincing idea starting from two random stimuli: here is a real collective challenge to unleash creativity in a crescendo of laughter and blows ... of genius!

The aim of the game is to find creative ideas and present them through a drawing. Two cards belonging to the "name" and "action" categories are drawn: The players have to draw an object or an idea by combining the two words.

The red stack (actions) and the blue stack (names) of cards are placed side by side and covered in the center of the table. The slates, markers and scorecard are kept at the players' disposal.

Starting with the oldest player, one competitor challenges all the other players one at a time. Competitors who do not participate in the challenges act as judges. An action map and a name map are drawn from the stacks and placed face up in the center of the table.

In a predetermined time, for example one minute, the current player and the challenger must draw a new object (a new idea) starting from these two stimuli (see example on the back). At the end of the time (or as soon as the contestants have finished drawing), the challengers present their ideas and the other players vote by majority on the best idea. The winner of the challenge earns one point. In the event of a tie, one point is awarded each. You keep one of the two maps and change the other, repeating the game in the same way. The game ends when all players have challenged all opponents respectively. The winner is whoever has the highest score at the end of the game.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Anagrammando
boardgame.description:
A fun and original word game for everyone where the goal is to write and make people guess a mysterious word. You have to be skilled with anagrams, but also fast, creative and intuitive!

The youngest player begins who takes the pink slate and a marker, draws an anagramm card, and puts it in the center of the table face up. He turns the spinner indicating the number of letters of the word to form, then starts the hourglass and, using the letters of the drawn card, try to form a word by writing it on the slate without showing it to others and revealing the initial letter.

The other players must try to guess the mysterious word in about 15 seconds of time and everyone has only guess. If no one guesses, the competitor on duty reveals the second letter of the word and, if he still does not guess anyone, reveals the third letter of the mysterious word. The round ends when a competitor guesses the mysterious word or no one guesses after the third letter.

The game continues with a new round, identical to the previous one (the player on duty changes clockwise). The spinner can indicate to form a word of 5, 6, 7, 8 and 9 letters. If the arrow points to the smiley face, the player can form a word with any number of letters, which he must declare together with the first letter of the word.

The playerho guesses the word on the first hit earns 3 points, on the second letter 2 points and on the third letter 1 point. If no one guesses, 3 points go to the author of the word. If the current player fails to form the word, he loses 3 points. The winner is whoever reaches 25 points first (or more, or less, at the choice of the players before starting the race).

When a competitor guesses the mysterious word, he plays with the anagrams: he takes the light green (large) slate and a marker and, in the time of an hourglass, tries to write as many anagrams as possible of the guessed word - you do not use all the letters of the word). To his normal score, he can add one point for each anagram of the starting word.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Semantica
boardgame.description:
A fast and fun language party game for everyone: combine words from the same field or make new and original connections.
Who is left with no cards in hand?

To understand how it works, you need to analyze how a card is built. Each of them, except for special cases, shows a colored (main) word and its hyphenation in the center. At the top, in the corners, a syllable that forms the word, while at the bottom, smaller, another (secondary) word of another color. The colors of the words depend on their category.

Each player receives 10 cards which he keeps face up in front of him, while the draw pile and discard pile are on the appropriate board. Jokers are split equally between each player. The aim is to run out of cards first by trying to add cards to the discard pile.

To discard a card from your hand, the color of the main word must be the same as that of the last card in the discard pile. It can also be the same as the smallest word at the bottom (secondary), but in this case the link between the main and secondary words must be explained. Or the card you want to play has the same syllable as the last of the discards. If you play a Joker, you can create a word using the syllables of your cards with that of the discarded ones. If you fail, you have to fish.

boardgame.name: Dieci
boardgame.description:
Between funny characters, forced exchanges and twists, whoever loses the five tokens is eliminated. Who will resist until the end?
A card game for everyone with an engaging mechanism, from 4 to 10.

Each player is given five tokens of the same color. The oldest player shuffles the cards well and places the deck in the center of the table. The objective of the game is not to remain at the end of the round with the lowest card in hand.

Starting with the player to the right of the one who shuffled the cards, and proceeding counterclockwise, each competitor draws a card from the deck, observes it and keeps it face down in front of him. The player who drew the card first begins and, based on the value of the card drawn, he can decide: to keep the card, because he believes it is a high card; • to exchange a card that he considers low with the player to his right, who cannot refuse to accept the trade, unless he is in possession of one of the highest five cards (6, 7, 8, 9, 10), which he must reveal to block the trade. The round continues counterclockwise and ends when all the competitors have made their trades. The last player of the round (the one who shuffled the cards) can decide whether to keep the card he drew (or received from an exchange), or he can make the exchange himself by drawing a card from the top of the deck. Once the play has been made, he reveals the card and invites the other players who have not revealed theirs to do the same. At this point the player who owns the card with the lowest value among those revealed pays a token. If two or more players have the same lowest card, they pay one token each.

The game continues by playing another round in the same way. The deck is shuffled in turn (counterclockwise). * When a player loses all five tokens in his possession during the various rounds, he leaves the game. The others continue to play until there is only one player left, who is the winner of the game. If, at the end of the game, there are two players left with only one token and, at the end of a round, both have the same card, neither of them pays a token and we proceed indefinitely.

If, at the end of a round, at least two players discover a Jolly Cat, none of them pays a token and the players eliminated during the previous rounds will be able to return to the game with a token!

boardgame.name: Feeling: Le emozioni in gioco !
boardgame.description:
An intriguing party game, which stimulates empathy between players. Tell an episode you lived and imagine the moods you felt: will others be able to guess them?

The youngest player starts and briefly tells a real fact that he has experienced or an imaginary situation that could happen to him, without naming the emotions he felt. In the situation described, he must imagine the prevailing emotions he felt before, during and at the end of what happened. He then writes on his card (with the erasable marker) the number 1 in correspondence with the emotion he felt before, the number 2 in correspondence with the emotion he felt during and the number 3 in correspondence with the emotion that he has tried in the end. All this, taking care not to show your card to your opponents. In the meantime, the other competitors also proceed to mark the emotions they imagine on their cards was able to try the narrator before, during and at the end. At this point, the emotion cards are revealed and scores are calculated by comparing the narrator's emotion card with those of the competitors. The game continues in the same way: the new narrator will be the next in a clockwise direction to the last hand, Warning: if during the story the narrator names an emotion (for example he says "I was very anxious before the exam") game and the turn passes to the next competitor.

Each competitor earns 1 point for each emotion right in the right time position within the story. He receives a 3-point bonus if he guesses all three emotions in the right order. The narrator earns 1 point for each of the emotions guessed by the contestants. Each player keeps his score by taking the appropriate tokens. The winner is the one who has scored the most points after 1 or 2 laps (at the competitors' choice).

boardgame.name: Lettera Velenosa
boardgame.description:
Have you ever tried to write a sentence avoiding the letter A? An original party game that trains your creative writing skills, but beware: you don't have to use the poisonous letter!

The youngest player begins, placing the letter marker above the letter board in any position (but which frames one of the letters well) and then moves it on the board by one or two steps (at his discretion, but only in horizontally or vertically). At this point he draws a subject map and the game begins. All competitors, within the time of an hourglass, must write (each on their own slate) a complete sentence of at least 5 words, which is inspired by an element of the map-subject caught and in which the letter indicated by the letter-marker: this will be the "poisonous letter": At the end of the round, the competitors who have managed to write a meaningful sentence earn a point for each word used in the composition (articles, prepositions and other monosyllables are not counted). If a player realizes that he has used the poisonous letter, he does not score points and also loses all those previously earned.

At the end of a round, the hand passes to the next player and the procedure is repeated. The game ends when one of the competitors reaches 50 points (depending on the agreements between the players.) If the subject maps run out, they are reshuffled. Wildcard If a player draws a subject map with a joker, instead it is played at the Letter Catcher. The player who drew the Jolly map draws another subject map to establish the theme of the test. Therefore, within the time of the hourglass, all competitors must write a complete sentence (of at least 5 words), which is inspired by an element of the subject-map drawn and is made up of as many words starting with the indicated letter. For each word that begins with the indicated letter, they earn one point.

boardgame.name: Contatto
boardgame.description:
Who will be the first to chain all their tiles together?
A language skill game in which the goal is to establish lexical links between words.
A little logic is needed but also a lot of creativity and imagination!

The winner is the one who gets rid of all their tiles first or who, if there are no more tiles to draw, has the least.

Each player spins the spinner. He draws or doesn't draw tiles according to the result. At this point he tries to place one of his tiles next to one of the sides of the starting tile (including those just fished), respecting the rule that the words placed side by side have a logical-linguistic link (the other competitors they can evaluate the relevance of the connection and possibly decide by majority vote to reject it) The second player proceeds in the same way: spin the spinner, draw 1, 2, 3 or no tiles and try to put his own tile next to both the first and the second game.

If a card is placed next to two cards, the logical-linguistic connection must obviously be with both cards. If a player manages to bring one of his tiles to two or more tiles on the bank, he is entitled to play a second tile of his.

Joker cards If a competitor owns or has drawn a joker card, he can play it by writing on the card itself, with the erasable marker, a useful word for the game.

boardgame.name: Visual
boardgame.description:
Who is the fastest to find a pair of identical figures, rotated, reflected or of the same color?
An addicting action game that trains the alertness and visual-spatial skills of young and old!

The deck of cards is shuffled and one half is taken, which is placed in the center of the table, with the side of the figures covered (played with half a deck). One of the players deals one card each. Each player looks at the card and reveals it, placing it straight (not oblique) in front of him (attention: once positioned it must not be moved until the end of the game). The player whose turn it is then takes the top card of the deck and places it face down in the center of the table: this is the bank card. He then reads the quiz on the new top card of the deck and turns over the dealer card. The goal of each competitor is to conquer the bank card just discovered, solving the quiz indicated on the top card of the deck before the others. The quizzes are expressed in such a way that each player must find a correspondence between a figure on his card and a figure on the bank card (see example). The first to find the right figures takes the dealer card (you have to be quick!) and shows the correct match. A competitor may take the dealer card even if he believes that between his card and the dealer card there is no correspondence required by the quiz card. In this case he declares: "None!" We then proceed to check: if the player has made the right observation, he wins the bank card; otherwise he leaves the game and cannot re-enter until the end of the game. The game continues in the same way, changing the dealer every turn.

Whoever has the most cards when the deck runs out wins. Attention: the player who leaves the game keeps the cards won, which are counted in his final score.

boardgame.name: X-Job
boardgame.description:
Baker, hairdresser, blogger, speleologist. In this fun party game, the goal is to make people guess the mysterious profession.
The secret to winning? Never be too explicit!

Each competitor takes a marker and a slate. The X-Job papers are mixed and placed covered, in bunches, in the center of the table. The spinner is kept close at hand.

The oldest player begins the dealer's turn. He draws an X-Job card (without showing it to others) and turns the spinner which will determine, based on the color released, which will be the job to guess: if, for example, the color pink comes out, he will have to guess the job which in the paper is in correspondence of the pink color. If, after a spin of the spinner, the smiley face comes out, the dealer has the right to choose a trade of his choice, writes it on the slate and can decide to block an opposing player for a turn.

Then he will say aloud the key skills of the mysterious profession and, based on his experience, he will try to provide first clue about the mysterious profession to the other players, but trying not to be too explicit. Each player writes his solution on the slate (without being seen by the others) and then the answers are checked.

If no one guesses, the dealer gives a second clue and then a final clue. Scores are awarded based on the number of clues revealed. The dealer will earn points if only one of the players has guessed the mysterious trade.

The winner is whoever reaches 30 points first.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Parole in Mente
boardgame.description:
Draw a category and compose a themed word ... but be careful: you only win if you form the longest word and use the least used letters.

Players draw 5 letter tiles per color from the dealer (5 blue, 5 green and 5 red, in total 15). The current player draws a category map. All the players at this point must form, with the available letters, a word that belongs to the extracted category.
When one of the contestants thinks he has formed a correct word, he counts up to 15 and at that point the game stops and points are calculated. It then continues with a new heat.

At each new round each competitor can decide to draw a new letter, but he must discard one of the same color (putting it back in the middle). The game always continues in the same way: the winner is whoever reaches 50 points (or more, or less, at the choice of the players).

boardgame.name: Emotions
boardgame.description:
What do you think about when you see a gift? You are happy Amazed? Or are you sad because you think about the gift you haven't received yet? In this party game both the guesser and the one who makes guess the right emotion win!

A player acts as the narrator: he draws an inspiration card and places it face up on the table clearly visible to all. He observes the card for the time necessary, thinks about a real or imaginary fact that aroused one of the emotions on the appropriate board and chooses the card corresponding to the emotion he felt, placing it covered in the appropriate space on the board. He then gives him a clue by briefly recounting the fact or describing the situation he imagined, avoiding pronouncing the emotion or making too explicit references to it (otherwise the turn is blocked and we proceed with another heat).

Immediately afterwards, the other players try to guess the emotion felt by the narrator, placing a vote-token on the board, near the square that represents the emotion that each one believes has been experienced and chosen by the narrator. You can use them for voting tokens of value 1, 2 or 3 depending on how convinced one is of one's intuition. Players vote one at a time, starting with the player to the right of the narrator. Once the voting is finished, the narrator turns the emotion card showing it to everyone and the bets are checked and any progress on the scoreboard is carried out. The turn passes to the next player starting a new game round. The first to complete two full laps of the board wins.

If only one player guesses correctly, the narrator advances by a number equal to double the token bet by the player he guessed right. • If two or more players guess the emotion, the narrator stands still in his position. • If no one guesses the emotion, the narrator goes back three boxes,

boardgame.name: Palo Largo
boardgame.description:
Bidding game in which the bids consist of a certain amount of matchsticks; the combined length of the matchsticks gives the height of the bid. Bids remain on the table during play and are affected by later actions during the game.

The game will be won by the player whose highest remaining bid after the last round is lowest.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Jump!
boardgame.description:
Are you more logical or creative?
Here is a very original party game that tests your problem solving skills, stimulating lateral thinking: the winner is the one who finds the most solutions using unusual tools and unleashing ... genius!

The player whose turn it is draws 4 instrument maps, placing them face up and side by side. Then he draws a situation card and reads aloud the text corresponding to the color where his placeholder is on the board. At this point each competitor, within the time of an hourglass, must find an effective and brilliant solution using the greatest number of tools discovered. Solutions must be written on the slate. If the current player is on the pencil box, the competitors will have to describe the solution only through the drawing. In this case the player whose turn it is reads any problem from the drawn card. When the time is up, the players present their solutions and calculate the scores. The game continues with another round: the new player on duty draws an instrument map and replaces it, at his choice, with one of those already active on the table, then draws a situation card and proceeds to a new game. . Scoring and end of the game If a solution is not considered valid by the majority of the players, it is discarded. The players who find a valid solution advance one square for each map-tool used. If a competitor has found a different solution from the others (original solution), he doubles the score. The winner is the first to finish 3 laps of the board (or more or less, at the choice of the players at the start of the race).

boardgame.name: Nomen
boardgame.description:
Find as many words as possible in a category and with the same initial letter, but beware, there are unpredictable rules: an animal with two identical letters, a food with at least one double?

The youngest player who discovers a letter map and an activity map begins. After the competitors have read the contents of the maps, spin the spinner which will indicate a category. At this point the hourglass starts and all the players must write on their slate as many words as possible that begin with the letter of the map drawn and that respect the specific indications of the map-activity. Also, the written words must belong to the category indicated by the spinner.

After the round, another starts and so on until a player reaches 100 points (or more, or less, at the choice of the players before the game): he will be the winner of the race. Each player scores 3 points for each "original" word (not written by anyone) and 1 point for "non-original" words (written by one or more players). The points are marked and updated on the appropriate card with the erasable marker.

boardgame.name: So Tutto
boardgame.description:
Who was Napoleon? How is the golden eagle made? In this fun party game, the winner is whoever provides the most news and information on a topic, among seven fields of knowledge.

The deck of knowledge cards is shuffled and placed face down in the center of the table. Each competitor takes a marker, a slate and four plus tokens (Where? How? When? And Why?) of the same color. The youngst player starts spinning the spinner and draws a knowledge card. All players must write on their slate attributes, qualities, characteristics or other elements, up to a maximum of four, which identify the topic present in the knowledge card in correspondence with the symbol indicated by the spinner. The first one who writes four attributes says "STOP" and counts up to 15, after which the other competitors also stop and score points.

When the spinner points to the wedge with the little face, the choice of the category is at the player's discretion. The game continues in the same way with another round (change the player whose turn it is clockwise). The winner is the one who reaches 30 points first (or more, or less, at the choice of the competitors).

Each competitor earns 1 point for each attribute identified. If the attribute is original, or was not identified by any other player, it is worth 3 points. The score can also double: after the spinner has been turned, but before the knowledge card is drawn, each player can decide to play one of the four plus tokens. Competitors who have played the token doubles the score for each attribute that answers the question contained in the token played: How? Where is it? When? and why? Played plus tokens must be set aside and can no longer be used. Furthermore, plus tokens cannot be played when the spinner lands on the wedge with the face.

boardgame.name: Lessicando
boardgame.description:
Do you really know the meaning of the words you use?
Find out with this fun party game in which competitors compete to formulate the definition of more or less difficult words: the winner is whoever is more convincing!

Procedure For each round there is a player who acts as a reader. The reader turns the spinner and draws a vocabulary card. He turns the hourglass and the other competitors will have to write a definition of the word on the card that corresponds to the color indicated by the spinner, while the reader searches the dictionary for the exact definition of the word. At the end of the time, each player votes for the most suitable definition but he can't vote his own), placing his vote token on the corresponding slate.

At this point the reader reads the definition of the dictionary and decides which is the best definition. The author of the best definition earns 3 points. In addition, each player earns 1 point for each vote received by his definition, even if it is incorrect. The points are marked in the appropriate form. The winner is whoever has scored the most points after a full round (i.e. after all players have taken their turns as player). Competitors can decide, before starting the race, to make the game last two, three or more laps.

The challenge: If the spinner indicates the wedge with the little face, the word card is not drawn but the reader indicates an opponent to challenge and the game is played in the following way: the reader chooses a word of his choice (taken from the knowledge base) and search the dictionary for the correct definition. He writes two definitions on his own slate, one right and one wrong, trying to trick the opponent. The opponent chooses the definition. If he gets it right, he wins 3 points, otherwise 3 points go to the player.

boardgame.name: Memo Challenge
boardgame.description:
An original memory game for everyone and for true champions of visual skill.

Memo Shuffle the cards and place them on the table face down to farm a 6x6 square. The youngest player turns 2 cards aver. If they are identical, the player wins them and keeps on playing. If the 2 cards are not identical, the player turns them back aver and it's the fallowing player's turn. The game ends when there are no more cards on the table, Whoever collects the most cards is the winner.

In Memo challenge The rules are the same as in the previous game.

At the beginning of the game though, the players decide on a joker shape (for instance a square) and a joker colour (for instance green). At the end of the game, one point is awarded for each card won and one extra point per card is awarded for joker symbols (shape and/or colour) on the cards (two squares = two extra points). The player with the highest score wins.

boardgame.name: Add Up
boardgame.description:
Look at the rows of numbers, study the opponents and play the right card to have two equal sums.

Shuttle the cards and deal 3 to each player. Then place two "opening" cards face up on the table, placing one above the other on an imaginary line. The rest of the deck stays face down at disposal for the game.

The youngest player starts. Each player, when it's their turns, plays a card either on the top or the bottom row. lf the sum of the cards on the top row is the same as that on the bottom, the player who put the final card down, wins all the cards on the table, otherwise it is the following player's turn.

When a player puts down their card, they immediately draw another from the top of the deck in order to always have 3 cards in their hands. When a player wins all the cards on the table, two new "opening" cards are placed one above the other from the deck and the game continues. When there are no more cards left in the deck, the players play the cards they are still holding until they are gone. Whoever has the most cards at the end wins.

boardgame.name: Optical
boardgame.description:
An original memory game that tests the visual-spatial skills of adults and children.

Shuffle the cards and lay them face down on the table either in an 8 x 8 square or placed randomly. The youngest player turns over two cards. lf they are the same (i.e. if they have the same image) the player keeps the cards and keeps on playing, otherwise he/she turns them face down aga in and it's the following player's turn. The game ends when there are no more cards left on the table; whoever got more couples, wins.

boardgame.name: Inventions
boardgame.description:
Shuffle the cards and place them randomly face down on the table. The youngest player turns over two cards. If these form a couple, the player keeps the cards and keeps on playing, otherwise he/she turns them back over and it is the following player's turn. The game ends when there are no more cards on the table. The player with the most cards at the end wins.

Invention timeline: Shuffle the cards and place them randomly face down on the table. The youngest player turns over two cards. If these form a couple, the player keeps the cards and keeps on playing, otherwise he/she turns them back over and it is the following player's turn. The game ends when there are no more cards on the table. The player with the most cards at the end wins.

The chronological timeline chart contains the names of the inventions from the oldest to the most recent. The matched pairs can be placed in chronological sequence, from the oldest to the most recent one, forming a time line of the inventions and their inventors.

boardgame.name: MasterBluff
boardgame.description:
The player on the left of the dealer starts by discarding one or more cards of the same family and saying it out loud. Whoever discards a card may lie about the object of the card, but must declare that the cards are all of the same family (for example: "two elves'; "two wizards'; "two witches'; "three fairies'; "three ogres'; "three jesters" and so on ... ). lf no one challenges the truth of the declaration, the cards are put in the discard pile and the game passes to the next player who continues to discard cards of the same family as those declared by the previous player (for example if the previous player had declared "two fairies'; the next player can declare to discard, for instance, "four fairies").

When it's their turn, each player can play the exchange token that allows them to change the card family to be discarded from the one declared by the previous competitor. The exchange token, once played, must be set aside.

After a player discards and declares the family group of their cards, any of the opponents may, if they believe the declaration to be false, call out "Bluff!. At this point the truth of the declaration is verified by checking the discarded cards with two possible outcomes: if the declaration is true, the player who called out "bluff" will be penalized by getting all the cards from the discard pile. If the player's declaration was false, the player who lied gets all the cards from the discard pile.

The player who discards all their cards first wins.

boardgame.name: Sequence-X
boardgame.description:
Shuffie the colour card deck and piace 16 on the table forming a 4 x 4 square. The remaining cards are placed face down in piles. Three target cards are drawn and placed face up in plain sight.

The youngest player begins by drawing a colour card from one of the piles and inserting it in a row or column of the 4x4 square, shifting the entire row or column. The colour card ejected from the square is removed and set aside. The goal is to replicate on the square one of the sequences shown on the three target cards.

Once a player finds one of the three target sequences in the square, they win the target card, draw another target card from the pile and place it face up above the square so that there are always three target cards showing. When the pile of colour cards runs out, players draw from the discarded colour card piles. it is evident that, by shifting the rows and columns on the square, each player must consider the new position of the colour cards that can then allow the representation of one of the target cards.

The winner is whoever earns 15 points first, summing the value ofthe target cards won (or more, if the players decide differently before starting the game). Target cards are worth 3, 4 or 5 points based on the number of colored squares in the sequence. Before starting players could also decide that the player with the most points wins when all the target cards (or a certain number of them established by the players) are drawn.

boardgame.name: Escape Math
boardgame.description:
Escape Math is an observation game based on calculations and "quick thinking':

Set up: Shuffle the white number cards and arrange them to forma 5 x 5 square. Shuffle the target cards and arrange them in piles next to the card square. The card in the center of the square marks the starting point. The aim of the game is to get out of the number square-maze.

At the beginning of a round, a target card is drawn and shown to all players. At this point, each player looks for a "mathematical path" on the grid starting from the card in the center and leading towards the edge of the square. Additions and subtractions of the numbers shown on the cards must result in the number shown on the target card.

By mathematical path we mean the passage from one card to an adjacent one by making a mathematical operation of addition or subtraction on each passage. The target cards, green or red, determine two game modes: if a green target card is drawn, the mathematical path must include at least one subtraction; if a red target card is drawn, the mathematical path must include at least two subtractions. As soon as a player finds a valid path they say "DONE!" and show everyone the path found by pointing at it with his/her finger.

If the math path is correct, the player keeps the target card. If the path is incorrect, the player is out for the rest of this round and the other players continue to look for their solutions. The winner is the first to get 5 target cards or a number of target cards previously decided on by all players.

Every five rounds, the cards on the square can be reshuffled. Error card The player who miscalculates is given the error card and sits the rest of the round out. lf, in the meantime, another player says "DONE!" and he/she is wrong too, that player will get the error card and sit the round out while the previous player with the error card can rejoin the game.

boardgame.name: Twin Cities
boardgame.description:
Form the pairs, but beware: the subjects are not exactly identical! A game for the whole family!

Twin Cities is a memory game for players of all ages. The cards represent an imaginary city and depict 36 pairs of subjects (similar but not necessarily identical in position or posture). The subjects can be people, animals or means of transport. Twin Cities Memory Arrange the cards face down in the center of the table forming an 8x9 rectangle.

The youngest player turns over two cards: if they depict the same subject (i.e. people, animals or means of transport), the player keeps the cards and continues playing; otherwise he/she turns them face down again and it's the next player on the right's turn. The game ends when there are no more cards left on the table; whoever has the most cards wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: More or Less?
boardgame.description:
A real challenge of calculation in mind: spin the spinner, roll the dice and find the pairs before the others!

Keep the spinner at hand and place the discs in the center of the table to form a circle so that they are easily accessible by everyone. Each player gets a token worth three points.

The youngest player starts by turning the spinner: the number indicated by the arrow will be the goal for this round. The same player throws all the dice within the circle formed by the discs. Now alil the players, at the same time, look for a pair of same-coloured dice whose sum or subtraction results in the number indicated on the spinner. Whoever identifies a pair must quickly take the discs of that colour.

For example, if a player finds a pair of red dice, he/she must take the red discs. The beige dice works as a wild colour dice; that is, it can be added or subtracted from the other coloured dice: In this case, the final number is obtained using three dice, two of the same color plus the beige one. The game continues until one of the players, asserting that there are no more useful calculation combinations, takes the black "stop" disc. At this point, the players proceed with the verification of the calculations and point counting.

Final scores and game goal For each correct calculation, a player receives 1 point for each disc taken using the beige dice and 2 points if they did not use it (i.e. using only two dice of the same colour). The player who takes the black token also collects 2 points, but if he/she also took other discs, this is worth 3 points! For each incorrect calculation, the player loses 1 point, or 3 if she/he took the black disc, too. The game continues in the same way until a player reaches 15 points becoming the winner! If two players tie at 15 points, a tiebreaker round will follow to determine the final winner.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Metaphora
boardgame.description:
This game triggers creative thinking through the production of metaphors and riddles.

Shuffle the cards and lay them face down in piles in the centre of the table. Each player takes a coloured writing card. Keep the other game materials close at hand.

The youngest player starts and is the first narrator. He/she thinks up a name (person, animal or thing) and writes it on his/her writing card without showing it: this will be the mysterious object. Then he/she draws a card from one of the piles and places it face up in the centre of the table, clearly visible to all players.

At this point the narrator has 1 minute to think up a way to describe the mysterious subject starting from the picture on the card face up on the table. As soon as he/she has thought of a sentence he/she pronounces it aloud. At this point, the narrator turns over the hourglass and all the other players must try to guess the mysterious object. Each player can say its name aloud.

When a player guesses correctly, the round ends and points are awarded. If no one guesses in time, a new round begins and the new narrator becomes the player to the right of the last one who narrator.

Here are some examples: if the mysterious object is a BOOK and the uncovered card represents a TABLE, the narrator say "it is a paper TABLE", or "it is a TABLE with a cover" and so on. If the mysterious object is a pair of TROUSERS and the uncovered card represents a LEMON, the metaphor or riddle could be: "it's a LEMON made of fabric" or "it's a LEMON that is peeled by unzipping it."

Both the player who guesses correctly and the narrator earn one point. The player who reaches 5 points first wins. Before starting the game, the players can also decide on more or fewer points in order to win. Scores are recorded and updated on the scoreboard by using the erasable marker.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Quick Stick
boardgame.description:
Who is faster to memorize the composition of the sticks? A fun challenge for everyone!

Each player is given a set of 6 coloured strips (red, blue, green, yellow, pink and white). Shuffle the cards from the deck and place them face down in the gray area on the console. Keep the spinner close at hand.

On each card there is a different figure showing 6 coloured strips. The first player who manages to get 8 cards (or more, if the players agree on a longer game) wins the game.

The thinnest player starts! He/she spins the spinner which will determine one of the following three challenges: figure, description or colour.

FIGURE: The player whose turn it is draws a card and shows it to everyone for a few seconds. Then he/she places it face down on the white area of the console. All players (including the current player) must recreate the figure shown on the card using their own strips, without necessarily respecting the position of the colours. The player who recreates the sequence first shouts "done!" If the player has carried out the task correctly, he/she wins a card drawing it from the deck, otherwise he/she skips one turn. If no one succeeds in the task, no cards are awarded.

DESCRIPTION: The player whose turn it is draws a card, observes it without showing it to the other players and begins to describe it using his/her own words (no hand gestures allowed). The other players, based on his/her description, try to recreate the figure while also respecting the position of the coloured strips. The first to recreate the described image, shouts "done!" If the player has carried out the task correctly, both he/she and the current player win a card each and they draw it from the deck. Otherwise, the player who had incorrectly shouted "done!" skips one turn.

COLOUR: Proceed as in the Figure challenge, but in this case the players must select and place in front of them all those coloured strips that, in the figure of the observed card, do not touch the coloured strip represented on the back of the card at the top of the deck.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Fantasia
boardgame.description:
Mime, narrator or graphic designer? A challenge that tests expressive skills, intuition and creativity.

The youngest player begins and draws an inspiration card and tums the spinner. The spinner indicates, in the outer circle, a theme (for example cinema), while in the inner circle, an action to be performed (for example, mimic). The player then has 20 seconds to find a subject that is consistent with the theme and inspiration card. He/she then writes the identified subject on the small board, without showing it to others. Subsequently, he/she has a minute to have the other players guess the written subject using the action indicated by the spinner. At the end of the round the scores are calculated and the game continues. The next player will be the one on the right of the last one to spin the spinner.

In addition to defining the theme (cinema, sports, art, music, occupations and literature), the spinner indicates one of the following tests: drawing (with the large board and erasable marker and without using letters), verbal explanation,(without pronouncing the words in the solution) and miming 9 (without uttering any words). When the spinner indicates the chain segment, the player must invite another player to play his/her turn, and to freely choose one of the three skills above indicated.

The winner is the one who first reaches 10 points (or more, or less, as decided by the players at the beginning of the game). In case of a tie, a play-off round will follow.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Konario
boardgame.description:
Train your brain with KONARIO! A super fun game for the whole family. Collect pairs with the help of taste, smell, touch, sight and hearing. When all the senses are activated at once, things happen in the brain.

When it's your turn, take a cube and turn it over. Taste, smell, look, feel or listen depending on the type of cube it is. It is important to get pairs together with two identical cubes. If you get a pair, it's your turn again, otherwise the turn goes to the next player. The one who has the most pairs when the cubes on the table are finished wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Timeland: A Taluva adventure
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Timeland, a stand-alone adventure in the land of Taluva.

A very long time ago, the goddess Atera gifted several treasures to the inhabitant tribes of Taluva, instead of living in harmony
the various tribes descended into war amongst each other. After many years of war and the island’s continuous
volcanic eruptions, the island of Taluva is now deserted, however the treasures remain buried on the island.

Welcome to Timeland. The objective of your group of explorers is to find the lost treasures buried on the island of Taluva.
Hurry to find as much treasure as you can before a further eruption of the volcano.

As a hardened adventurer, you will create a team of explorers to go on and find « The Taluva* island ».
Upon arriving you will find an uninhabited island containing 5 temples full of riches…
Your aim is to find four treasures and restore the sacred tablet before the lava engulfs the last vestiges.
The challenge will be not be easy. Communication between players will be limited to the restricted activation of their walkie talkies
and the varying risks will occupy a significant amount of their time. One solution to win, good communication and coordination.

• A cooperative game • 5 Temples to vary the pleasures • 3 levels of difficulty for every player •

Bienvenue dans Timeland.

Il y a fort longtemps la déesse Atera offrit de nombreux trésors aux tribus de Taluva. Malheureusement, plutôt que de vivre en harmonie, celles-ci décidèrent de se faire la guerre pour récupérer tous les trésors et conquérir l’entièreté de l’île. Après de nombreuses années de guerre et d’éruptions volcaniques, Taluva est a présent déserte, les tribus ont disparu et leurs trésors avec...

Bienvenue dans Timeland. Votre groupe d’explorateurs est en quête de savoir et de trésors perdus au sein de l’île de Taluva.
Dépêchez-vous de rassembler tout ce que vous pouvez avant que le volcan n’entre en éruption une dernière fois...

En tant qu’Aventurier aguerri, vous décidez de former une équipe d’explorateurs pour partir à la découverte de Taluva*.
En arrivant sur place vous trouvez une île inhabitée avec 5 Temples regorgeant de richesses…
Votre objectif : Trouver 4 trésors et reconstituer la tablette sacrée avant que la lave n’engloutisse les derniers vestiges.
Le défi ne sera pas simple car la communication entre les joueurs est limitée à l’activation restreinte de leurs talkies-walkies
et les dangers vous feront perdre du temps. Une seule solution pour gagner, bien vous coordonner et communiquer à bon escient.

• Un jeu de COOPÉRATION • 5 Temples pour varier les plaisirs • 3 niveaux de difficulté pour tous les joueurs •

listing.notes: Price is including shipping within EU!
Title: Timeland: A Taluva adventure Publisher: Ferti Language(s): English German French

boardgame.name: Treppenlabyrinth
boardgame.description: Players build a three-dimensional maze and attempt to be the first to reach the 5th floor at their target column (one of nine) with one of two game pieces. Between the columns stairs can be installed to advance. Action points are available for all actions (build, move, tear down). The higher you have already climbed, the fewer action points you get. The first to reach the top wins.

boardgame.name: Polihisztor
boardgame.description:
In Polihisztor, players in their turn roll a 6d dice. If they landed in a blue space, they pick up a question card. The card has 5 trivia questions, if they answer correctly they move one step forward. If they don't then nothing happening.

The game ends when a player has stepped in all four castle. The players have 4 "puppets". They must conquer all the 4 corners.

The first player who has won the four corners, wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Pets
boardgame.description:
Fleeing from the big city rush, many people prefer living in direct contact with nature. In Pets, you moved in with your family to a countryside house, with a huge and arborized plot, and even a small pound of deep and cristal clear waters. Now your goal is to occupy all this space with the Pets your family loves so much!

Throughout six rounds, you must lure Pets from eight different species: Cats, Dogs, Rabbits, Turtles, Parrots, Poneys, Birdies, and Fishes. After you get these animals, you can interact with them in six possible actions: Sunbath, Feed, Take Care, Play, Sleep, and Breed. But that's not enough, because you need to plan your moves carefully and fulfill your secret goals.

Pets has a quick and simple game system, for children age eight and up, and another one more complex and challenging for adults. It's also included the expansion "Special Pets".

boardgame.name: Dwar7s: The Lost Tribes Expansion
boardgame.description:
There is a calm before the storm, a brief moment that you almost feel safe. In the last few weeks, we had no attacks. Instead, more and more monsters gathered by our walls... Waiting. It's time to prepare!

This expansion includes 3 asymmetric tribes, the Ogres, Half-bloods and Crystal Dwarfs, and can be played with Dwar7s Fall, Winter, Spring, and Summer (Coming Soon!). It is also compatible with all previously released Dwar7s expansions.

Components:

80 miniatures

92 cards

01 rulebook

03 player boards

21 tokens

boardgame.name: Sci-Fi Rescue: A Solo Game
boardgame.description:
Rescue a scientist from a disintegrating space station while fending off assorted nasty animals.

This is a follow on to several previous games (Sci-Fi Escape: A Solo Game, Sci-Fi Return: A Solo Game) but can be played as a stand alone game.

Ideal for 28mm figures but any size will do as long as they are individually based.

Turn Sequence:

Activate your forces
Activate any creatures
Roll for random events

boardgame.name: Hell is Other Demons
boardgame.description: Steam description - Hell is Other Demons is an action-platform shooter, with Roguelite elements. Explore a sprawling, hand-crafted world full of demons, insanely over-the-top boss fights, and a heavy synthwave soundtrack.

boardgame.name: Infected! Narrator (GM) Screen
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb from Kickstarter:

You asked for it. Now it's here. The Infected! Narrator Screen! On one side, our epic art (I love this image... so it might be fitting), and on the other, quick-reference rules for the Narrator. This will be of high-quality card (a little less thick than the front cover of a book), and will be three folding panels.

This is a limited edition screen!

We are only printing this for the Kickstarter, so get in now. They will be gone. Actually... I'm getting one myself. Now I have to have one (watching my own vids, I crave the awesomeness of the screen... it will be mine!).

boardgame.name: Rival Megagun
boardgame.description:
Steam description - Manic. PVP. Battle. Shmup.

Transform into your Mega Gunship boss form to blast your rival head-on in this unique shooting game with a competitive twist.

Rival Megagun is a competitive split-screen vertical shmup (or shoot 'em up, shooting game, STG) where you transform into a gigantic boss ship - your "Mega Gunship" - to invade your opponent's screen.

boardgame.name: Monolith
boardgame.description: Steam description - Monolith is a top down action shooter with procedurally generated elements. Explore a large, abandoned facility in search of incredible power, fighting dangerous foes and gaining new weapons and upgrades as you progress.

boardgame.name: Little Bug
boardgame.description: Steam description - A bittersweet adventure platformer where you coordinate two playable characters who share a physics based swinging mechanic in real time. Nyah can walk and pick up items, while her spirit light can fly and explore dark areas.

boardgame.name: Jetstream
boardgame.description: Steam description - Jetstream is an elegant and relaxing puzzle game where you soar amongst the clouds. Play through dozens of sculpted levels as you guide your plane to its destination. Jetstream has been designed to be a frictionless experience - it’s just you and the puzzles!

boardgame.name: Scipio: Sworn Enemy of Hannibal
boardgame.description:
Aut viam inveniam aut faciam. (I shall either find a way or make one.) — Hannibal the Barcid. In 203 B.C. two genius strategists vied for the fate of the world.
Hannibal: The renowned Carthaginian general; and Scipio: The Roman Hero.

SCIPIO is a two-player strategy board game: players take on the role of military leaders to command the armies of an ancient age to crush your enemy. Develop a formation and give orders to your armed forces — never be too aggressive nor too passive.

The game is played over a series of rounds.
Phase One
1.Place command cards.
2.Reveal Command Cards.
3.Deal Damage.
4.Draw New Orders Cards.

Phase 2
The second phase repeats the steps of the first phase.
The only difference is the Command cards available to you. Both players can only use the remaining 3 cards that they didn't play in the first phase.

Phase 3
Shuffle Strike Order tiles and Return Command Cards to Hand.

If any one of your opponent's Formations becomes empty (has no tokens in it) when they remove Troop Tokens, The game is over! and you win.

—user summary
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Studium Mundi (スタジオムンディ)

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 2 bis 2 Spieldauer: 30 Minuten Altersempfehlung: 10+
SCIPIO: SWORN ENEMY OF HANNIBAL - „Aut viam inveniam aut faciam.“ („Entweder werde ich einen Weg finden oder einen bauen.“) – Hannibal Barkas
