Im 3. Jahrhundert vor Christus traten zwei militärische Genies gegeneinander an, um das Schicksal ihrer Reiche auszufechten: Der berühmte karthagische Feldherr Hannibal und Scipio - Held der römischen Legionen.
SCIPIO ist ein taktisches Brettspiel für zwei Personen. Als Heerführer zur Zeit der Punischen Kriege versuchen die Spieler, die Armee ihres Gegners auf dem Schlachtfeld zu besiegen. Dazu müssen sie ihre Truppen geschickt aufstellen und das richtige Gleichgewicht zwischen Angriff und Verteidigung finden. Ähnlich wie in einer tatsächlichen Schlacht kommt es dabei darauf an, den Gegner zu durchschauen ohne selbst durchschaut zu werden, jeden Schritt sorgfältig abzuwägen und dennoch kühne Entscheidungen nicht zu scheuen, denn - wie es heißt: „Fortes fortuna adiuvat“ – das Glück hilft den Mutigen. Welcher Anführer wird am Ende mit einem Triumphzug gefeiert werden?
＊Strategiespiel für zwei Spieler ＊Einfache, aber tiefgreifende psychologische Kriegsführung ＊Der Nervenkitzel, die Strategie des Gegners zu überprüfen!
Inhalt: 1 Spielbrett 1 Sichtschirm 68 Truppenmarker 3 Initiativeplättchen 12 Befehlskarten 10 Manöverkarten 6 Spielanleitungen
https://youtu.be/kKbvdSMKvq0
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE, ES, EN, FR, IT, JP

boardgame.name: Post-Fight Perdition
boardgame.description: From the back of the book: You have just won the biggest fight of your career! Now only one opponent stands in your way to winning your first ever Bantamweight World Title! But as you celebrate your victory, events rapidly begin to spiral out of control, and you soon find yourself being stalked by a madman in your own home! Will you be able to fight your way to freedom, or will all hope of survival GO SOUTH? This book contains an interactive short story where the reader makes the decisions for the main character. It is written in straightforward prose for older teens and adults who struggle with reading and places the reader straight into the action where their choices determine who lives and who dies. It doesn't require any dice, pencils or erasers to play; you only need the book. [Please note that this book contains content that would not be suitable for children, including depictions of monsters, blood, dismemberment, suicide, drug & alcohol abuse and family violence.]

boardgame.name: Introduction to Advanced Dungeons & Dragons Game
boardgame.description:
From the back of the box:

Everything the First-Time Player Needs!

Introduction to Advanced Dungeons & Dragons Game

Imagine you have entered a fantasy Realm with Monsters, treasures, and daring deeds to be done! Play a heroic fighter or cunning wizard. Explore old castles and chart the depths of mysterious dungeons. The Advanced Dungeons & Dragons game has no limits. Your character can do anything you can imagine.
boardgame.rpgseries: Advanced Dungeons & Dragons 2 Introductory Box Sets

boardgame.name: Sonic X-treme
boardgame.description: It was intended to be the first fully 3D Sonic the Hedgehog game, taking Sonic into the 3D era of video games, and the first original Sonic game for the Sega Saturn. The storyline followed Sonic on his journey to stop Dr. Robotnik from stealing six magic rings from Tiara Boobowski and her father.

boardgame.name: Uncharted 3 - Drake's Deception Map Pack
boardgame.description: It is the final of four map packs for the Fortune Hunters' Club.
boardgame.videogamecompilation: Uncharted 3: Drake's Deception – Game of the Year Edition

boardgame.name: SwitchBack
boardgame.description:
Players' teams consist of four hikers, who all start on the corresponding color base camp at the bottom of the mountain.
On a turn, the player rolls two dice, and may move either one or two of their hikers in a clockwise direction on the game board. Upon reaching a trail marker of their own color, the hiker climbs a level towards the mountain summit.

Special movements, called Bump, Switch, and Conditional Switch, can quickly change the game. "Bumping" allows you to knock rival's hiker down a level, and "switching" allows you to trade your hiker's place with an opponent's hiker's place.

Be the first team to get all four hikers to the summit to win.

boardgame.name: GUNBARE! Demo
boardgame.description:
publisher blurb
GUNBARE! is a power fantasy military sci-fi TTRPG designed for 2-5 players. Inspired by the premise of Azur Lane, Armored Core, and the works of Tsutomu Nihei, play as a Fleetgirl, a living weapon onboard a generation ship currently running from a hostile alien empire.

Across three distinct generations of spaceship-girl, utilize a venerable arsenal of kinetic, explosive, thermal, particle, and cyber weapons to wage a desperate war against the Xenos.

What the Demo has:


1 Class
12 unique weapons across 7 different sets
20 unique tags that can change how a weapon operates
Basic loot progression
25 different enemy stat blocks
2 encounters
Basic mission generation with mechanics for each type
Basic GM guidelines
A little bit of lore
A Shenanigans ability

boardgame.name: EXO
boardgame.description:
publisher blurb

It's Time To Hunt!


EXO is a card based, GM-less one-shot TTRPG designed to bring the investigation and hunting gameplay of video games like Monster Hunter and Horizon Zero Dawn to the TTRPG space and combine it with the idea of being a badass exosuit pilot. In Exo, players take on the roll of exosuit pilots tasked with hunting a massive kaiju, but they'll have to track it down in the wilderness first!

You'll build your pilot, choose and modify your Exosuit and use the series of random generators and events to craft the biome, habitat and creature that you're hunting. Exo currently has a full creature generator, completely GM-less rules and 8 character classes (exosuits) to mix and match for your preferred style of play.

What You'll Need:
2-5 Players
A standard deck of 52 playing cards per player
The provided Character and Hunter's Log sheets.

boardgame.name: Csoda és Kósza: Ollé!
boardgame.description:
The main characters of Wonder and Lollop, two horses from a Hungarian fairy tale series.

Wonder and Lollop have ransacked Uncle Cheese and Auntie Daisy's wardrobe and put on all sorts of clothes. Sometimes they dressed up as Santa Claus, sometimes as pirates, and sometimes they mixed up the outfits completely. Many of their friends also came.
At the beginning of the game, players introduce themselves as a friend.

The game involves recognising when Wonder and Wanderer are dressed the same and naming as quickly as possible the name of a horse friend, represented by a player, who has the same outfit on that player's card.

The first player to name it gets the other player's card.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Koszos Fred Kártyajáték
boardgame.description:
Koszos Fred kártyajáték (Dirty Fred Card Game) was manufactured in small scale in 1985, Hungary. The game combines the excitement of poker, the simplicity of ulti (a Hungarian card game), and the charm of knock rummy. The game consists of the beloved characters of the famous writer, Jenő Rejtő. Some provide special powers, like Koszos Fred (based on the character Piszkos Fred, or Dirty Fred in English). Players are trying to achieve the most points, by collecting red cards and hitting other player's cards.

"It is advised to sign the back of the Koszos Fred card, so in case of drawing it, one can easily acquire him. Obviously we do not take responsibility for the resulting fistfight, missing teeth, or broken limbs/skulls."

boardgame.name: Libertad o Muerte!
boardgame.description:
"Libertad o Muerte! represents the wars of independence of the Spanish Colonies in America. A turn-based (each turn being 6 months of real time) game, with a huge map of Latin America and nearby regions.

Players can take control of the Patriots or the Royalists, and guide them through 1810-1825 to achieve their military objectives, managing military resources, armies and fleets and starting or reacting to events. Cunning play of the event cards received each turn will be critical to final success.

Features
Huge map divided into areas covering all of South America, Central America and the Caribbean, as well as remote locations such as, Cádiz, California, Texas and part of the USA in 1810.
Hundred of land and naval units depicting historical leaders and forces.
Most important cities and forts in the represented regions.
Military Resources Production and Management.
Two deck of cards, one for each player, cards represent historical events and also bring into play various type of assets and tricks (economics, combat, new troops, fate, etc…).

Scenarios
Mexico: Covers the rebellion in Mexico, Texas and Florida 1810-1820
La Plata 1810-1823: Covers the rebellion in the Viceroyalty of Peru and the Viceroyalty of La Plata.
Bolivar: Covers the rebellion in the Viceroyalty of Nueva Granada and part of Peru. 1810. 1822
Grand Campaign 1810-1825: The full campaign unifying the rest of scenarios.
¡Early Years! 1810-1815: A medium-sized campaign, its the Grand Campaing limited to the first 5 years of the war.

Gameplay
Two players, either in hot seat or PBEM mode. Solo play versus the AI.

Game Duration
According to the scenario, from 4h00 to many hours when playing the Grand Campaign."

From HeadquarterS.L. and Avalon Digital

Available for Mac and Windows
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 Charles S. Roberts Best Pre-20th Century Computer Wargame Nominee

boardgame.name: Trapped: The Bank Job
boardgame.description:
TRAPPED turns ANY room into a family-friendly escape-room adventure. In The Bank Job, you and the other players are a gang of bank robbers. Intel suggests that if you’re a party to this one job, you’ll be set for life! Locked in a secure vault and under heavy surveillance, can you work together as a team to pull off the crime in the nick of time?

Sleeping gas has knocked out the security guards and everyone else in the building, so you’re safe for now…but hurry! In sixty minutes you’ll need to choose your strategy: finish the mission—or abort and run!

Comes with everything you need to turn any room in your home into a fully immersive escape room. Solve the riddles, get the clues, and get out before getting caught up. Instructions and hint books are included, just in case.

-description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Samana
boardgame.description:
There are two game versions, one for 2 and the other for 4 players.

In the 2-person game, you move your pieces from your base across a 6*10 board by rolling the dice (1, 2, 3) and try to capture enemy pieces and bring them to your base.
The player who has the last remaining game pieces wins.

In the 4-person game, you play on a 6*6 board and try to knock other players' pieces off the board by rolling the dice. The last player to have game pieces left wins.

boardgame.name: Zombicide: 2nd Edition – SIlver Metal Dice
boardgame.description:
Additional dice set for Zombicide (2nd Edition).

Contains: 6 silver metal dice

boardgame.name: How to Embrace a Swamp Creature
boardgame.description:
publisher blurb
How to Embrace a Swamp Creature gives you an austerity crushed commuter town, friendships debating their continued existence, toxic air, visions of the stench, zombies trekking out of the bog for a pub breakfast, pride and madness; asking “What do you do next?”

In the game you play a friend group of mentally ill twenty somethings living in Swamp Strange, a commuter town wrecked by over a decade of austerity. Connected by train to Leafdon, sustaining the city, being sustained by it, being drained by it, an overflowing drain that struggles to remember it’s a town.

A strange magic pervades Swamp Strange. Breath in the Stench of the weird wetlands and feel knowledge crawling in the dark corners of your mind. You and the other swamp creatures shambles through your routines but you can’t help but feel the cracks in the mud.

Your friend group used to see each other all the time: because you had to. Context forced you together and you became friends through that. But the context is gone. You’ve moved on. But you’re still friends; for now. Two of you had been dating but you’ve been broken up for a while now; one of you is finally managing to move out. Confront aimlessness, confront intimacy, look at what you’ve meant to each other and what you mean to each other
boardgame.rpg: How to Embrace a Swamp Creature

boardgame.name: Turf War
boardgame.description:
In this yard-building card game, you race to prove to your neighbors that your lawn is the best on the block – or destroy your rival in the process.

Every game starts with a different, randomized group of Neighbors, each with their own set of criteria. At the start of your turn, you must choose to be Home or Away, giving you access to a different set of actions that you can perform. While Home, you can gain points and abilities by playing cards onto your yard and swaying Neighbors to your side. While Away, you can earn money and get new cards from a shared store, but you leave your yard vulnerable to your rival's mischief. When the last Neighbor has been swayed, the game ends, and whoever has the most points wins.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Breach Wanderers
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





Breach Wanderers combines elements from Collectible Card Games and Roguelike Deckbuilders in a brand new way! Choose your hero and conquer your foes by combining fully customizable decks of cards, guild upgrades and powerful items!Wander The Breach
Blending together RPG’s, CCG’s and Roguelike Deck builders, Breach Wanderers is a single player, card-based game that gives players countless strategies to play with! Choose your hero, create your deck and get ready to embark in a cyber-fantasy adventure! Obtain resources to upgrade your guild and your heroes. Unlock new cards to create entirely new decks with pure creative freedom.

Features

Create your own card set
Create your own starting deck and card pool before departing for a run. You'll never see a card you don't want to see! Breach Wanderers opens up a world of strategic possibilities to play with when fighting through the breach.

RPG Customization
Customize your heroes to get them prepared for the challenges to come. You can further tune the game to your playstyle with customizable guild upgrades!

Every run is unique
While you can choose how you begin a run, what awaits you in the Breach is different every time! Monsters, special events, items and challenges are all randomized, making every run a unique adventure!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Guildmasters
boardgame.description:
Experience true creative freedom in Guildmasters as you combine items, skills and heroes to create an infinite variety of unique and interesting builds.

Reflective tanks, evasive healers, glass-cannon attackers, inspiring bards, the only limit is your imagination!

Master Your Guild
Customize your heroes in this unique RPG, choose from hundreds of items and skills to craft, upgrade and equip. Upgrade your guild, heroes, and challenge monsters of unimaginable power! You play as the Guildmaster of a unique band of adventurers, on a quest to defend the world from a grave threat. Dark stirrings in the Cadenn House foretell of an ancient evil waking once more...

Strategic Idle Gameplay

Select your skills and customize your characters stats in advance. Fight monsters in Idle based combat and discover the secrets of Guildmasters. With hundreds of skills to choose from, can you find the perfect combination of heroes and skills to defeat each enemy? Monsters are hard to defeat and require significant strategy in how you customize your hero before the fight in order to achieve victory! Did we mention the whole game is playable offline?


Dungeon Crawling Fantasy RPG

With tons of in game depth, set up your character’s build with near infinite customization, tuning the stats and gear of your hero however you want! Discover exotic locations and dungeons ranging from the overrun factories, to abandoned temples. Equip the right characters to conquer the dungeons, fight monsters, and get rewarded in loot


Become a Guild Master

Recruit unique heroes for your adventurers from a collection of unique, memorable characters. Each with significant depth in their own backstory and skill trees. From the Deadly assassin Mirley, to the defensive spellcaster Gliocan, all your Guild’s Heroes are all unique! Just as unique are the monsters of Guildmasters, ranging from the traditional fantasy villain of slimes to the terrifying double sworded scythe cyborgs and Dragons. The more monsters you defeat, the more the fights become a puzzle, where you need the proper strategy to vanquish your foes!


Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Electromaze Tower Defense
boardgame.description:
Electromaze Defense is a classic tower defense game where you create your own maze. With a wide variety of maps, towers and upgrades, Electromaze Defense will keep you hooked for hours on end! Can you build the perfect maze?

Construct Your Maze
Electromaze Defense is a classic tower defense game where you create your own maze. Using way points, it allows the player to build a maze with a whole new level of complexity. With a wide variety of maps, towers and upgrades, Electromaze Defense will keep you hooked for hours on end! Can you build the perfect maze and set up the best defense possible?

Features
Waypoint Pathfinding

Enemies have to go through several waypoints on the grid before reaching the end of the maze. Use it at your advantage in order to build a maze that will trap them in for as long as possible!


14 Unique Towers

Each tower is unique with its strengths and weaknesses. Place them carefully to make sure you are using them to their full potential.


Each tower can also be upgraded with one of 4 Utility Upgrades. Use these upgrades wisely and your maze will be even more deadly!

Enemy Abilities

As the waves become harder, enemies will unlock various abilities such as blinking, healing, or even summoning more enemies! Be prepared, for these abilities are designed to mess with your strategy!


Bosses

What good would a tower defense be without bosses? Not only are these enemies tough, but they will make your life even harder by boosting nearby ships!


Random Level Generation

When you are done with the tutorial and challenges we have prepared for you, you can face the real challenge! An infinite variety of random maps featuring an infinity of levels. How far can you get before the enemies get too strong?


Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Ein Hindernisrennen mit 6 Würfeln
boardgame.description:
Each player rolls 6 dice and decides which results to keep and which dice to roll again. The end result is entered into the results table. Each player gets 7 turns. In line 1 all dice with show a "1" are added. The same counts for line 2 to 6. For an entry in Line H one has to roll a sequence of 1-2-3-4-5-6 to get 42 points. If the result of a turn can't be used in any line, one line has to be canceled.

After 7 turns the added results are entered in Line S. The Player with the most points wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Takaro! Into the wild
boardgame.description:
This is a standalone expansion for Takaro! that can be played with the original game or on it's own.

Learn more te reo so you can korero about our beautiful ngāi kīrehe (fauna) & ngāi tipu (flora).

Takaro! Into the wild adds 57 new words from animals and nature into the Takaro family. Game play follows the original game so these 57 new playing cards & 8 new reference cards can be combined with the new version or played on their own.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Takaro! Bits + Bobs
boardgame.description:
This is a standalone expansion for Takaro! that can be played with the original game or on it's own.

This time we're learning everyday household objects to make it even easier to start using te reo in your whare. Gather around the tēpu and kēmu on!

Takaro! Bits + Bobs adds 57 new words from everyday life into the Takaro family. Game play follows the original game so these 57 new playing cards & 8 new reference cards can be combined with the new version or played on their own.

—description from the publisher
